story:
STEP BY STEP IN CONTRIBUTING TO AN INDIEGOGO CAMPAIGN: 

http://support.indiegogo.com/entries/20494567-how-to-contribute-to-a-campaign

SHIPPING:

Shipping to the US, Philippines, Singapore, Hongkong, Japan, Australia, UAE, New Zealand, and Canada is included. For other countries, please add $25 for shipping. Please also check this note regularly for any updates, we are still on the look out on ways to minimize the shipping cost. Thank you for your understanding on the matter. 

SWCF WEBSITE: 

http://www.soilwatercebu.org/

http://www.swcfi.blogspot.com 

SWCF FACEBOOK PAGE: 

http://www.facebook.com/pages/Soil-and-Water-Conservation-Foundation/340748590670

SWCF CAMPAIGN FACEBOOK PAGE:

http://www.facebook.com/pages/SWCF-indiegogo-campaign/280507092059127

SWCF TWITTER:

https://twitter.com/soilwatercebu

SWCF YOUTUBE:

http://www.youtube.com/soilandwatercebu

FUN FACT:

  • The TIER names are based on Philippine Dipterocarps (Hardwood).

 

Soil and Water Conservation Foundation, Inc. (SWCFI) began in 1985 as an informal network of persons of several nationalities concerned with the global ecological challenge and the necessity of broad-based local initiatives to respond to that challenge. The networks’ extensive experience in natural resource management in the Philippines and other parts of the world lent itself to a bottoms-up approach to planning, a participatory system of management, an equity-led development focus, and a facilitative style of assistance to public agencies and private organizations involved in environmental projects.

The Foundation was incorporated in March 1988. Since it's incorporation, SWCF has implemented 91 projects in five regions of the country with main emphasis is in Region 7, the Central Visayas in the middle of the Philippines. 

For more information, please check : http://www.soilwatercebu.org/about-us

 

 

 

 

 

 

FOR A COMPLETE LIST AND MORE INFORMATION OF OUR PAST PROJECTS, PLEASE CHECK THE FOLLOWING LINK:

http://www.soilwatercebu.org/projects

 

 

For helping us get closer to our goal of US$300,000, we have prepared some exciting and cool perks just for you! Please check a quick rundown of the perks we are offering:

  • Memory Tree named after you.
  • Memory Grove named after you.
  • Book Corner/Mini Library named after you (perk will be rolled out in the following days).
  • Tuition for a local working student (perk will be rolled out in the following days). 
  • Virtual Postcard. 
  • e-books published by SWCF. 
  • Tshirts. 
  • Button Pins.
  • Keychains produced by a local community in Bohol. 
  • Your name on our website and Donor Board at SWCF Training Center. 

Please keep visiting our campaign page as we add new tiers and perks. 

 

 

Pictured above are some of the merchandise we are offering as perks. When the campaign period expires, we will send a form to the donors who selected tiers with tshirts and button pins as perks, you can fill out the form to select which design you would like to receive. Also with the form will be a size chart for the shirts. 

Please also note the the merchandise on the image is for presentation purposes only, actual tshirt may differ from the image. The button pin is definitely not as big as pictured. We will also post image of key chains on future updates. 

  

 

When we reach the $300,000 goal, we will be able to do the following:

  • Sustain SWCF’s day to day operation for another three (3) years.
  • Fund the Livestock Dispersal program (Carabao, goats, swine, fowl) for rural upland farmers to enhance their livelihood.
  • Building maintenance fund for the Biodiversity Training Center in Bilar, Bohol. 
  • Continued monitoring of recently ended projects.
  • Plan future community development projects.

 

Any amount that we get beyond the goal of $300,000 will be used towards the following:

We are not aiming to go way beyond our goal of $300,000 like LET'S BUILD A  GODDAMN TESLA MUSEUM or the BUGASALT. Something similar to PE' SLA: HELP SAVE LAKOTA SIOUX SACRED LAND! or the ANGRY VIDEO GAME NERD: THE MOVIE is more than we could hope for. But if you decide to give us more than our goal, the following is SOME of the things we would like to do with the extra fund:

  • Support students with summer employment at the Bohol Biodiversity Complex so they can earn funds for college tuition and expenses. 
  • Provide funding for public high schools in Bohol to visit the Bohol Biodiversity Complex and learn about their natural heritage.
  • Expand the Book Corner program to provide rural schools with educational materials.
  • Upgrade present information materials about local biodiversity for local high school teacher to enrich their classes.
  • Upgrade the training center facility at the Bohol Biodiversity Complex.
  • Purchase of new equipment for documentation like camera, laptop, etc. 
  • Enhance SWCF Staff Development Program.  

 

 

 

 

Hello friends,

 

Soil and Water Conservation Foundation, Inc. a non-profit NGO for raising environmental awareness, among others, have recently launched an INDIEGOGO campaign at www.indiegogo.com/soilandwater. We aim to raise funds to help sustain Soil and Water Conservation Foundation, Inc. and to continue monitoring recently concluded projects. We would like to ask for your help by viewing our campaign page and sharing it amongst your friends. If you could also donate any amount, we would be forever grateful! For more information about INDIEGOGO and our campaign, kindly check below.

 

WHAT IS INDIEGOGO?

Indiegogo is a crowdfunding platform where people who want to raise money can create fundraising campaigns to tell their story and get the word out. Indiegogo is also a place to discover what people all over the world are passionate about and how to get involved.

 

HOW CAN YOU DONATE TO AN INDIEGOGO CAMPAIGN?

Donate to an indiegogo campaign using a credit card or your paypal.

 

STEP BY STEP IN CONTRIBUTING TO AN INDIEGOGO CAMPAIGN.

http://support.indiegogo.com/entries/20494567-how-to-contribute-to-a-campaign

 

OUR INDIEGOGO CAMPAIGN, PLEASE HELP US SPREAD THE WORD:

www.indiegogo.com/soilandwater

 

Thank you and may you have a wonderful day!

story:
A Short Summary

Check out the video above of our 2010 show! Over the years we've done an amazing consumer fireworks show for our friends at Norris Lake, Tennessee. We've skipped a couple of years due to financial issues and scheduling but I have had many requests to do another fireworks show at Bellville dock over the 4th of July Holiday for 2013.
 
As many of you are aware, the shows I have put on over the last few years have been pretty good for a consumer show however, they are a bit expensive and even though I can purchase in bulk at a discounted rate, I usually have had around $2500 or more in expenses.

With that said, I'll need your help covering the cost to bring the shows back to "Hooty Hoo" Cove!

I absolutely love doing these shows as I'm a pyro at heart but can't justify (or afford) spending that much each year on my own. Many people have suggested that I ask for donations in advance which I hate doing because the show is kind of a thank you from me to all my lake friends for making the summer special. But, in order for me to do this again I'll need some help from everyone who wants to see it happen.


What We Need & What You Get

We need approximately $2500 for class C (1.4G) fireworks, fusing materials, shipping costs and miscelleneous supplies.

We do all the prep work (I start a month in advance of the show laying everything out), site set up (we'll be working the day of the show while you enjoy the lake around you), and that evening we'll light the sky for your eyes!

I purchase fireworks in bulk at wholesale rates and my previous shows have be about $2500. I start my purchasing in the winter months for best discounts but if we don’t reach our entire goal all money will be refunded.

Perks!

We have Perks for different Donor Levels! Check out the perks for donations to the right!

The Impact

Every little bit you contribute gets us closer to our goal. We need your help to make this happen and we only ask that you help us with whatever you can aford or feel it's worth to you.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Get the word out to other lake friends we may have missed.
  • Make sure you use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thanks so much for your support!

story: Who are we? We are Latino and African American youth. Brothers, sisters, sons and daughters. We are students, activists, community organizers, artists, and we are concerned about the mindless destrucion of our Mother Earth, our Father Sky and the well being of all our relations. For many years we have organized around the environmental issues that affect us in our community. We have surveyed and studied the roots of our environmental problems. We have raised awwareness and protested. We'ver held events, built gardens, built allies with neighbors, organizations, institutions and mentors. We facilitated countless toxic tours of our neighborhood, lost battles and won some.  Our most recent victory is the closing of two coal power plants, Fiske and Crawford; they agreed to close up their toxic factories, Fiske in 2012 and Crawford in 2014. We are dynamic individuals, ready to take our activism abroad to Panama on a Rainforest Awakening adventure. In the Bocas del Toro region, the Naso and Afro-Panamanian People, are fighting to maintain their quality of life as indigenous people. Current construction of a Hydro-electric dam threatens them. The Rainforest Awakenings program offers a holist approach to environmental protection, through meditation, trust building activities and the practice of council we will learn to protect nature and build community. We will vision solutions and learn new ways to organize our communities against environmental violence. We intend to document and share the struggle of the Panamanian people, the beauty of the land and our transformation as community leaders. What We Need & What You Get We have had success leading fundraising campaigns in our neighborhood. Now, we are learning about the power of fundraising on-line. We have applied for scholarships and are hosting fundraisers in our schools and community. It is our hope that you will join our efforts to grow as leaders, build stronger global community and protect the planet. During this campaign, we are requesting funds to contribute to 10 passports and our program deposit for 12 students. 10= passports (10 X $125) Deposit for 12 students (12 X $325) = $5150  Check out our unique perks! You will also get information on what is happening in Panama from our unique Youth perspective and directly from Panamanian people. You can connect with us and follow us on Facebook. If we do not reach our fundraising goals, students will still purchase their passports to be used for study abroad programs in college. The funds will be saved and additional fundraising efforts will take place to prepare for this trip for this year. We are also fundraising and writing grants for plane tickets, additional program costs and equipment neccessary The Impact Environmental Impact: Awareness will be raised about the destruction caused by power plants on a global scale. We will be able to directly connect our local struggles with that of the Panamanian people and understand on a deeper level why the work we do is so important. We will be better informed about root causes of environmental destruction and experience a holistic approach to rainforest preservation. We will be empowered by knowledge and experience and better prepared to speak with other young people about real ways that we can continue to protect the planet. This will be the creation of an alternative model of how to support young leaders as they work to create a healthier planet. Social Impact: The lives 10-12 Chicago youth will change forever! They will reap the benefits of your generosity and concern for others. This will have a tremendous positive effect on their self-esteem and will also teach them how to build quality relationships with others and the global community. They will gain heightened leadership skills, advocacy skills, interpersonal and intrapersonal skills, cultural diversity and awareness skills, and have a broadened perspective of the opportunities available to them as they become successful adults.  Many more young people will be inspired and encouraged by the youth that will benefit from this amazing experience.   8 More reasons why this project is impactful! - Youth will document there journey and bring that documentary back to there respective communities  - Youth will become stronger leaders that will pass the torch to the next generation, which is also known as rites of passage -Youth will gain applicable communication and relational skills for college, jobs and entrepreneurial ventures -   Youth will gain global leadership skills, critical thinking skills, and strategizing skills -   Youth will experience the healing power of Mother Earth and community -   Youth will have the opportunity to participate in healing circles to share their experiences and connect with a community that understands and cares -   Youth will learn about the importance of relying on natural resources versus industrialized resources  -Youth will understand how social injustice impacts the world and their ability to participate in the creation of a healthier planet. Other Ways You Can Help Please Make some noise about our project and Share this with everyone you know!!  Thank you!

story:
Short Summary

 VRSLouisville is expanding our scope to make sure that all members of our community and especially children are protected from Radon.  Along with testing homes of low-income families, we are also focusing on where our kids (and your kids) spend a majority of their days.

In Louisville, there are over 100,000 children are under the age of ten and 39,000 of them attend daycares regularly either in preschool activities or after school programs.  How many children can be saved from Radon issues including asthma, pulmonary problems, cancer and even death?

 

There are over 400 daycares in the Greater Louisville Metro and many of these locations are based in private homes.  Daycare regulations along with the Fire Marshall yearly inspections, do not have any regulations or testing for Radon contamination.

Based on measurements to date, it has been estimated that over 30% of all homes tested are contaminated with Radon above the EPA limits. Think about it.  One out of three homes in Louisville, children and even infants are being exposed to the same carcinogens as regular smokers.   

Even making the problem worse, the Center for Disease Control (CDC) has shown that due to the size and rapid respiration of children, the risk of lung cancer resulting from exposure to radon may be 2 times as high as the risk to adults.  If children are also exposed to tobacco smoke, the risk of getting lung cancer increases at least 20 times.  Personally, we have measured homes as high as 28 which equates to smoking 3 packs of cigarettes a day or having 4 chest x-rays per day.  Every person in that house, including infants are constantly being bombarded by Radon.  Radon is a REAL DANGER and we cannot be fast enough to address this.    These children have no ability to protect themselves and VRSLouisville is focused on improving the quality and longevity of their lives. 

Our goal is to protect young families and children from the dangers of Radon.  With over 21,000 deaths per year in the US, more than traffic deaths, Radon is a silent killer that has no smell, invisible and is very prevalent throughout Jefferson County.  We know this program will SAVE LIVES and we ask you to get behind this effort. Any type of donation would be helpful.  We believe that environmental justice should be blind when it comes to our children.  Every child in Louisville has the right to breath clean, non-contaminated air and we as their parents and caretakers should do whatever is needed to make sure that they have a safe place to live and play.

We have identified the enemy in the war and it is Radon.  Our focus is the make all of Louisville safe from this killer and your contributions with be a great first step on getting us there.

 With this $500,000 public-private raise, we expect to spend $400,000 on testing and mitigation programs,  and then donate $100,000 to local non-profit organizations to help educate Louisville, bringing Radon into everyone’s conversation in our Metro area.

story:
Our Story

We at Shift like to find magic in the mundane. After being inspired by a cutting edge UN report on the potential of waste, we decided to commit ourselves to being at the forefront of this energy revolution – nay, a poo-volution!

We’ve spent months learning the science behind converting poo into power (known as anaerobic digestion), finding the right design for our energy domes, scoping out villages in Pakistan where this would be successful, and building a fantastic team (the author of that UN report is now part of Shift!). Since launching earlier this year, we’ve built two fully functioning energy domes in the village of Kakka Kolu, outside of Gujranwala, Pakistan.

We've received overwhelming support from local residents who would like to see more of our domes - which brings us to this campaign.

 

 

The Vision

Our grand vision at Shift is to spark an energy revolution and shift the way people think about waste. We imagine a world where we can transform the potential of something discarded into something valuable. This campaign is the start of the poo-volution!

We see Shift’s energy domes providing free, safe energy to people around the world, preventing poor health and also preventing climate change. Let us explain.

 

Problems We’re Addressing

Shift aims to tackle two huge global problems: 1) access to safe energy and 2) climate change

Access to Safe Energy 

1 in 3 people use unsafe energy, leading to 3.5 million preventable deaths a year. By providing clean gas, Shift prevents these people from using unsafe firewood for their cooking needs. Firewood is dangerous because it leads to smoke inhalation and a host of respiratory and other health problems. Gas doesn’t. For villages without any electricity, this gas can also be used in lanterns to provide free lighting.

Climate Change

We’re also preventing climate change by capturing and using methane gas that would otherwise be released from cow waste into the atmosphere. Experts say 15% of global greenhouse gases come from animal emissions (mostly cows), more than even cars!

 

Solution – Nuts & Bolts

Does converting poo into power sound too good to be true? It’s not!

The science of anaerobic digestion supporting Shift’s energy domes is real and proven.

  • When you have organic waste in an oxygen-free environment (like our energy domes), bacteria naturally break down the waste, releasing methane gas and carbon dioxide, also known as biogas, which can be used as cooking fuel.

  • Anaerobic digestion has been around for a long time but most people just don’t know about it. Shift is ready to introduce this technology to the world and enhance it! We’re proud to be partnering with leading research universities in Canada to improve the energy dome design to maximize gas output from the same amount of waste.

  • From the farmer’s perspective, Shift energy domes are easy to use and require no maintenance since there are no moving parts and the domes are made of bricks and concrete. We’ve spent a lot of time making sure we developed a durable, long-lasting dome that can be used for decades.

  • Once a day, the farmer needs to load roughly 150 kg of waste (4 wheelbarrows worth) into the energy dome after mixing it with water. And that’s it. The Shift energy dome takes care of the rest.

  • Bacteria break down the waste, the methane gas rises to the top of the dome and is then piped to people’s home kitchens where it’s connected to a small stove. And when the gas builds up in the dome it pushes down and forces the remaining solid waste to be pushed out of the dome where it is then used as nutrient-rich fertilizer for crops in the fields. Nothing gets wasted in the process!

Shift energy domes can work in any village where there are at least 20-30 cows (basically, a lot of waste!)

 

Impact

Each dome can support the cooking and lighting needs of about 25 people for the rest of their lives. These people are saved from having to use harmful firewood to cook anymore!

One of the stories that motivates our work is that of Fatima*, a young woman we met in the village of Khipro, Pakistan who contracted tuberculosis as a result of inhaling a lot of wood smoke while cooking in her family's small hut. Unfortunately, Fatima's story is not unique and is shared by many people who do not have access to safe energy. Fatima's story is one we never want to see repeated again.

* real name changed

From an environmental perspective, with each dome we’re preventing roughly 4 cubic metres of methane emissions per day which is the same as removing 24 cars off the road!

 

Campaign

We’re looking to raise $20,000 (USD) to build 10 energy domes in remote villages in Pakistan. Specifically, we want to build energy domes in Kakka Kolu and Khipro (interior Sindh). In Khipro, many of the residents don’t even have access to electricity so Shift's energy domes will provide free energy for that too.

If we're fortunate enough to exceed our goal, we'll simply build more domes and help more people!

 

Each dome costs only $2,000 (USD), which includes high quality materials and labour. 

Your generous contributions will help support hundreds of residents by providing free, safe energy.

Join us and become a Shift Disturber!

 

Team

We're lucky to have a team of global leaders in biogas and cleantech. You can learn more about who we are here
story_txt:
Our Story
We at Shift like to find magic in the mundane. After being inspired by a cutting edge UN report on the potential of waste, we decided to commit ourselves to being at the forefront of this energy revolution – nay, a poo-volution!
We’ve spent months learning the science behind converting poo into power (known as anaerobic digestion), finding the right design for our energy domes, scoping out villages in Pakistan where this would be successful, and building a fantastic team (the author of that UN report is now part of Shift!). Since launching earlier this year, we’ve built two fully functioning energy domes in the village of Kakka Kolu, outside of Gujranwala, Pakistan.
We've received overwhelming support from local residents who would like to see more of our domes - which brings us to this campaign.





 


 
The Vision
Our grand vision at Shift is to spark an energy revolution and shift the way people think about waste. We imagine a world where we can transform the potential of something discarded into something valuable. This campaign is the start of the poo-volution!
We see Shift’s energy domes providing free, safe energy to people around the world, preventing poor health and also preventing climate change. Let us explain.
 
Problems We’re Addressing
Shift aims to tackle two huge global problems: 1) access to safe energy and 2) climate change
Access to Safe Energy 
1 in 3 people use unsafe energy, leading to 3.5 million preventable deaths a year. By providing clean gas, Shift prevents these people from using unsafe firewood for their cooking needs. Firewood is dangerous because it leads to smoke inhalation and a host of respiratory and other health problems. Gas doesn’t. Shift is ready to introduce this technology to the world and enhance it! We’re proud to be partnering with leading research universities in Canada to improve the energy dome design to maximize gas output from the same amount of waste.
From the farmer’s perspective, Shift energy domes are easy to use and require no maintenance since there are no moving parts and the domes are made of bricks and concrete. We’ve spent a lot of time making sure we developed a durable, long-lasting dome that can be used for decades.
Once a day, the farmer needs to load roughly 150 kg of waste (4 wheelbarrows worth) into the energy dome after mixing it with water. And that’s it. The Shift energy dome takes care of the rest.
Bacteria break down the waste, the methane gas rises to the top of the dome and is then piped to people’s home kitchens where it’s connected to a small stove. And when the gas builds up in the dome it pushes down and forces the remaining solid waste to be pushed out of the dome where it is then used as nutrient-rich fertilizer for crops in the fields. Nothing gets wasted in the process!

Each dome can support the cooking and lighting needs of about 25 people for the rest of their lives. These people are saved from having to use harmful firewood to cook anymore!
One of the stories that motivates our work is that of Fatima*, a young woman we met in the village of Khipro, Pakistan who contracted tuberculosis as a result of inhaling a lot of wood smoke while cooking in her family's small hut. Unfortunately, Fatima's story is not unique and is shared by many people who do not have access to safe energy. Fatima's story is one we never want to see repeated again.
* real name changed

From an environmental perspective, with each dome we’re preventing roughly 4 cubic metres of methane emissions per day which is the same as removing 24 cars off the road!

We’re looking to raise $20,000 (USD) to build 10 energy domes in remote villages in Pakistan. Specifically, we want to build energy domes in Kakka Kolu and Khipro (interior Sindh). In Khipro, many of the residents don’t even have access to electricity so Shift's energy domes will provide free energy for that too.
If we're fortunate enough to exceed our goal, we'll simply build more domes and help more people!

 
Each dome costs only $2,000 (USD), which includes high quality materials and labour. 


Your generous contributions will help support hundreds of residents by providing free, safe energy.
Join us and become a Shift Disturber!
 
Team
We're lucky to have a team of global leaders in biogas and cleantech. You can learn more about who we are here

story: 10 out of 14 states in Myanmar formerly known as Burma have been affected by widespread flooding and landslides. According to BBC news four areas have been declared as disaster zones and many areas are still completely cut off by high waters or damaged roads. Reportedly, up to 300,000 people have been displaced or become homeless. People in disaster zones are dying everyday due to lack of food, clean water and basic necessities for life. We know that our efforts can only be possible because of the contributions we would receive from generous donors like you. "Every penny counts to make the changes"

story:
We Deserve to Inherit A Healthy Planet

  • We must all become leaders in our own lives and our communities to change the direction we are headed ~ Xiuhtezcatl Martinez 13yr old youth director of Earth Guardians

Earth Guardians is an organization of dedicated youth from around the world. We are committed to standing up to protect the Earth, Water, Air and Atmosphere so our generation, and those to follow, inherit a healthy, just and sustainable planet. We are focusing on weaving together the synergy of individual grassroots youth driven projects around the globe, to create one international, intergenerational movement for effective change.

Earth Guardian leaders have had the opportunity to participate, inspire, speak, give presentations and perform at youth conferences, festivals, rallies and schools around the globe. Young people are being inspired to take their creative passion into local action by starting Earth Guardian crews in their own communities after seeing how empowering and effective this work can be to create positive change.  These visionary young people need a strong and well-organized team to support them. 

We need help raising funds

  • to build our online Earth Guardian action portal and guide
  • strengthen and expand our local infrastructure
  • launch our "Protect Our Future" campaign
  • support and build our global team
  • pursue travel and speaking opportunities to spread our message
  • empower the expansion of Earth Guardian crews around the world

The Time Is Now

Young people are becoming more aware of the dire state of our planet. They know if we continue to be disconnected from the earth, isolated from each other, and driven by consumption - we will literally destroy our own life support systems. Pollution, climate change, fossil fuel energy, corporate greed, and toxic lifestyles are taking their toll.

Youth Leaders

We believe that today’s youth have a vital role in addressing our global crisis and in creating the world we want, and deserve to live in. There is a movement on the rise of young leaders from all over the world standing up to protect our future and help heal the critical state of our planet.


Successful Organization

The Earth Guardians have a long history and have been building a successful organization powered by youth since 1995. Our central hub in Boulder, Colorado, works on local, national and international issues as well as providing the support system and management team to assist youth around the globe in building successful campaigns for positive change.  Right now, we have 22 Earth Guardian crews spreading from Boulder to Brazil, New Mexico to Australia, Florida to France. We even have a group in Togo, Africa that has over 500 members, and thousands of individuals who have joined Earth Guardians from around the globe!

Endorsements

___________________________

Andy Lenec:
"Not only are Earth Guardians thoughtful and committed, they have been taking action to raise awareness and promote an agenda of non-violent change to improve our environment, save our ecosystems, and literally show us how easy (and sane) it is to make conscious decisions about our survival. Now as they are taking responsibility to lead us into a better future, they are asking you, their friends and supporters, for your financial support, so they can continue to expand their work with the resources they need."

___________________________

Bill McKibben of 350.org:
 "Xiuhtezcatl, youth director of Earth Guardians is an impressive spokesman for a viewpoint the world needs to hear!" 

___________________________

Julia Butterfly Hill:
"Xiuhtezcatl is a vital voice for our time. Combining art and creativity with passion, commitment, and clarity, he represents as well as models what it is to be the change our world and planet needs. He speaks powerfully from and connects deeply with both the mind and the heart. I am in awe of who Xiuhtezcatl is and all he has already done at such a young age. No matter our age or background, we can all learn from him."

___________________________

Carolanne Wright of Natural News:
"Let's remember that our young ones are watching and we have a responsibility to be role models, support their expression and give them a voice in their future. In the case of the Earth Guardians, perhaps adults can learn a little from these kids about speaking up for the safety of our communities, the air, and the water."

___________________________

Be Inspired

We the youth, and future generations, have the most to lose because of our environmental, climate and social crisis. We hope that you will be inspired by our work and join us in standing up for the Earth and our future.

With your support we can continue expanding a global movement to empower a generation of young people to create a healthy, just and sustainable world.

Please consider a donation through our fundraiser and visit our website for more information and other options: EarthGuardians.org

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Share with your networks
  • Send emails
  • Link on Facebook
  • Tweet about us
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Building Up a Sustainable Model to Share with the World...

It's easier said than done, first of all. My name is Brendan and I've been living this way for 6 months now... chopping my wood for all my heat and most of my cooking, counting the watts on all my devices to make sure they don't over-tax my limited solar panel setup, carrying gallons of water every day from the closest spigate, hanging up my clothes to dry over the stove. I didn't build my house, but that's OK because I have enough on my hands with 3 toddlers and trying to stay connected to friends, family and work out in the connected world.

My career until this point has mostly been in IT Repair, Web Design and Consulting. I've helped promote and organize campaigns for digital start-ups half a world away against all odds, started the odd business or two, and made many peoples' dreams come true on the Internet. I have also worked full-time helping manage the marketing and logistics of a major organic farm and (thankfully) been able to manage a vegetable garden each year. The transition out of the cushy IT lifestyle and hard off-grid living hasn't exactly been easy, but I think it's worth it in the long run. I hope you'll hear out my pitch and bear with me on how I think my work here can help everybody in the long run, even those who don't want to slog it out in the woods like this. Here I am hoping to develop methods that people can use to live this way and stay connected to school, business and the rest of life - so they can be an example of living in a positive way. We need to develop urban sustainability as well - because if everybody left Seattle or New York to live in the country, we'd ruin the environment.

It’s important to note that EarthStar is my own brainchild and neither I nor my organization ultimately control the use of this property or have an assured permanence here. We are not attached to the outcome in this given situation. Any potential donors or subscribers should know that EarthStar will continue to be a shifting canvas of ideas, individuals and locations not limited to this one which we currently inhabit. We are doing this in the interest of the ideas, designs, information and learning experience that can come out of this and any number of situations. Our intention as the organization known as EarthStar- as a hopefully global community – is to assist in the establishment of independent intentional communities everywhere. While we are staying on this property we hope to create more renewable energy systems, water biofiltration, no-till permaculture gardens with a wide cornucopia of varieties of organic veggies, grains, fruits and legumes. Read More about EarthStar here...

The Situation, In A Nutshell...

We live in a tiny house in the woods at the edge of the Olympic National Park, on a sustainable farm that is over 100 acres of pristine forest. Our heat mainly comes from wood from the property, and our power comes from 120 watt solar panels on the top of our small cabin. Our basic needs of living are covered – and except for want of more sustainability and more resource security, this way of living has a richer, more abundant quality than life lived in isolation in a much more expensive on-grid apartment or house. We have another value system which prioritizes the development of community, family, connection to nature, independent learning, and ecologically sustainable systems of resource use. We hope to document the process of adding energy and food production features onto the cabin and the property, as well as creating a handful of geodesic greenhouses and passive-solar structures. Everything we do is being done with the intention of including it in the website, video logs, e-books and other channels of information.

We're asking for help financially to purchase the equipment we need and secure the time to build the prototypes in question. We need to create the baseline of security necessary to continue doing both our high-tech and low-tech work out here, without reliable power or internet currently, in order to educate the world in the ways we are using to get by. We have designed the systems we're using and we are designing more to use soon. We will be making wind generators and mini hydro generators and even generators to use the excess heat of buildings and wood stove exhaust to make power as well. We are building the content base of our website and monetizing it with links to products and services that help the Sustainability Initiate get started, and everybody else get paid and keep things going.

What We Are Doing Now.

  • No-till permaculture terrace garden.
  • Full-time egg production with 10 layers, 2 roosters and 10 new pullets growing up.
  • Off-grid solar panel setup on 4 cabins.
  • 1 acre total of fenced garden area and soon to add another 1/2 acre with fencing.
  • Wood-heated gravity shower system.
  • Natural pioneer-style log buildings built with mostly recycled or sustainably harvested materials.
  • Tiny well-organized homes and sheds for heating efficiency and less “stuff”.
  • Natural wreath, pinecone and ornament decoration to accompany the tree business for the holidays.
  • Laying the beds for winter with biomass, dirt, and well-aged compost – then planting them with overwintering cover crops.

What We Are Promoting Online (Ongoing).

  • On-Grid and Off-Grid Solar
  • Electric Vehicles and EV Conversions
  • EarthShips and other Passive Solar Building methods
  • Earth-Conscious IT (there is a way..)
  • Wind Generators
  • Biomimicry
  • Climate change consciousness
  • MoveToAmend and the pursuit to end corporate personhood.
  • Ecosystem Repair
  • Rainforest trusting and other direct conservation
  • Direct democracy, digital activism and other progressive grassroots action

What we will be starting on soon (expect design plans as perks..):

Energy

  • Vertical-axis wind generators for tops of buildings.
  • Smart venting system to use excess heat from passive solar and wood as a power source.
  • "Micro-hydro" generators to harness rooftop rainwater collection for mini-hydroelectric energy production.
  • Solar/wind “icebox” – refrigerator connected to the overflow charge on the charge controller – freezing a block of ice in a tub in the freezer and keeping the fridge cool.
  • Read More on Website

Food

  • Solar lighting setup and insulation for chicken coop (to keep up egg production).
  • Underground food storage for stores in case of winter storms (we are pretty high up in the mountains).
  • Insulated, heated geodesic greenhouse, with wind-powered multi-spectrum lighting assistance to maintain growth levels even in winter.
  • Read More on Website

Buildings

  • Eco-friendly modular and configurable building panels for stable or temporary shelter or food production.
  • Partially-underground greenhouse / passive solar building.
  • Community activity and child fun space for use in homeschooling, workgroups, potlucks and other events.

Information Technology

  • Web and app based "do engine" to make it easier for people to network resources sustainable projects.

Water

  • Underground cisterns, rain catches and ponds to maintain levels in the dry season.
  • Solar water purification and distillation.
  • Rain gardens and ponds throughout garden courses.
  • On-site biofiltration and water treatment with estuary flora and microorganisms.

Community

  • Focus groups, workgroups, group ritual, and community building trust exercises.
  • Weekly potluck dinners.
  • Bi-weekly "talking circle" meetings.

What We Need the Money For.

Most of the materials we need we can get recycled. As much as we can, we will be using products and materials that we can recommend and monetize with on the website.

Energy

  • 3 Low-speed generator kits (for wind / convection turbines)
  • 2 High-speed generator kits (for mini-hydro gens)
  • 500W More PV Solar panels.

I.T.

  • 1 GoPro camera.
  • Off-grid Satellite Internet Setup

Buildings

  • 1x2 lumber
  • Hinges
  • Clear polycarbonate.
  • Clear vinyl

Food

  • Food seeds of all kinds.

Water

  • Concrete for pouring cisterns.
  • PVC, gutters, valves and ducting.

Where We're Going With This And Why We Need Your Help.

As we start these other individual projects, we will also be starting micro-funds for the prototype development – stay tuned. For the projects we will be working on right now, we are designing perks for the plans to build these simple energy devices. Right now we need to buy some time and materials to accomplish a number of projects to prepare for winter. With our own money, we will be primarily investing in maintaining power, food, and egg production – and keeping everyone warm in their shelters. With your help, we will be putting together a number of models and prototypes of independent energy devices, developing the more unique technologies, and laying more of the groundwork here to provide stable basic needs in the long run.

We hope to develop this community into yet another example to the growing map of connected intentional communities that are creating their own resource base from the ground up. We will be providing plans and detailed instructables for everything here. Expect high-resolution detailed plans for the structures and energy devices as low-priced kickbacks. Unfortunately we are not in a position to offer fully-functional products as kickbacks, and are making no promises to do so – though that situation may change as more prototypes are developed and testing begins. Everything we develop will be open source and free to modify and distribute as you see fit – so it gets out there and begins to affect the globe – but please be sure to give initial credit for unique features.

Natural pioneer-style log buildings built with mostly recycled or sustainably harvested materials.
Tiny well-organized homes and sheds for heating efficiency and less “stuff”.
Natural wreath, pinecone and ornament decoration to accompany the tree business for the holidays.
Laying the beds for winter with biomass, dirt, and well-aged compost – then planting them with overwintering cover crops.
What We Are Promoting Online (Ongoing).
On-Grid and Off-Grid Solar
Electric Vehicles and EV Conversions
EarthShips and other Passive Solar Building methods
Earth-Conscious IT (there is a way..)
Wind Generators
Biomimicry
Climate change consciousness
MoveToAmend and the pursuit to end corporate personhood.

Ecosystem Repair
Rainforest trusting and other direct conservation

Direct democracy, digital activism and other progressive grassroots action


What we will be starting on soon (expect design plans as perks..):Energy

Vertical-axis wind generators for tops of buildings.
Smart venting system to use excess heat from passive solar and wood as a power source.
"Micro-hydro" generators to harness rooftop rainwater collection for mini-hydroelectric energy production.
Solar/wind “icebox” – refrigerator connected to the overflow charge 
on the charge controller – freezing a block of ice in a tub in the 
freezer and keeping the fridge cool.

Read More on Website

Food
Solar lighting setup and insulation for chicken coop (to keep up egg production).
Underground food storage for stores in case of winter storms (we are pretty high up in the mountains).
Insulated, heated geodesic greenhouse, with wind-powered multi-spectrum lighting assistance to maintain growth levels even in winter.
Read More on Website
Buildings
Eco-friendly modular and configurable building panels for stable or temporary shelter or food production.
Partially-underground greenhouse / passive solar building.
Community activity and child fun space for use in homeschooling, workgroups, potlucks and other events.
Information TechnologyWeb and app based "do engine" to make it easier for people to network resources sustainable projects.Water
Underground cisterns, rain catches and ponds to maintain levels in the dry season.
Solar water purification and distillation.
Rain gardens and ponds throughout garden courses.

On-site biofiltration and water treatment with estuary flora and microorganisms.


Community
Focus groups, workgroups, group ritual, and community building trust exercises.
Weekly potluck dinners.
Bi-weekly "talking circle" meetings.
What We Need the Money For.Most of the materials we 
need we can get recycled. As much as we can, we will be using products 
and materials that we can recommend and monetize with on the website.Energy
3 Low-speed generator kits (for wind / convection turbines)
2 High-speed generator kits (for mini-hydro gens)
500W More PV Solar panels.
I.T.
1 GoPro camera.
Off-grid Satellite Internet Setup
Buildings
1x2 lumber
Hinges
Clear polycarbonate.
Clear vinyl
FoodFood seeds of all kinds.Water
Concrete for pouring cisterns.
PVC, gutters, valves and ducting.
Where We're Going With This And Why We Need Your Help.


As we start these other individual projects, we will also be starting
 micro-funds for the prototype development – stay tuned. For the projects we will be working on right now, we are designing perks for the plans to build these simple energy devices. Right now we 
need to buy some time and materials to accomplish a number of projects 
to prepare for winter. With our own money, we will be primarily 
investing in maintaining power, food, and egg production – and keeping 
everyone warm in their shelters. With your help, we will be putting 
together a number of models and prototypes of independent energy 
devices, developing the more unique technologies, and laying more of the
 groundwork here to provide stable basic needs in the long run.
We hope to develop this community into yet another example to the 
growing map of connected intentional communities that are creating their
 own resource base from the ground up. We will be providing plans and 
detailed instructables for everything here. Expect high-resolution 
detailed plans for the structures and energy devices as low-priced 
kickbacks. Unfortunately we are not in a position to offer 
fully-functional products as kickbacks, and are making no promises to do
 so – though that situation may change as more prototypes are developed 
and testing begins. Everything we develop will be open source and free 
to modify and distribute as you see fit – so it gets out there and 
begins to affect the globe – but please be sure to give initial credit 
for unique features.

story:
Our Story

The Tapiche Reserve was created with the intention of preserving the rainforest  and giving the locals a better way of life, providing a alternative way of income instead of logging or irresponsible and depredatory hunting and fishing. We have so far accumulated many rewarding signs of progress:

*Tripadvisor

http://www.tripadvisor.com/Attraction_Review-g294315-d3187519-Reviews-Tapiche_Reserve-Iquitos_Loreto_Region.html

* Mammal Watching

http://mammalwatching.com/Neotropical/neotropicperu.html

One year ago, after the reserve rested for 2 years with no hunting and  logging, and funded by own investment to maintain the locals in different small projects like building cabins, trails and surveillance, we opened for visitors to start providing new jobs for the locals as visitor guides for ex hunters and as cooks and staff at the lodge for the wives and families.  

We have a new policy (for Peru) in the tourism, different than most of the places that have animals in captivity or in domestic condition. We promote to visitors the experience of real jungle with wildlife in the wild, as it should be.

For that we chose an area that has amazing biodiversity, and the jungle is incredibly preserved. Located 400 km away from iquitos, 100% of the people working at the Tapiche Reserve are locals to the area. We have built cabins, we have transport (the most expensive part of it), we have accommodation for staff and guests, trails and a program that has made the Reserve one of the most well-rated attractions in the north of the Peruvian Amazon. All the structure we built with our own funding, and the income from visitors provides just enough (sometimes even less) to meet the monthly maintenance coast.

With a quick look throughout web sites of attractions around Iquitos you will soon found out that most of the animals are in captivity or domestic condition. We want to change that, showing people the animals in natural conditions in their habitats. Even if we don't see animals, just experiencing the preserved primary rainforest is a great experience. But for the jungle and the animals to be preserved and protected we have to give the locals a better opportunity of life, providing them alternative income and education.


Our Project

We want to build a 40 meters canopy tower with sleeping accommodation on the  level below the top terrace for overnight observation.

With this project we will provide at least 3 to 4 months work for the locals. Once it is finished, we will be able to attract visitors with deeper specific interests, like bird watchers, scientists, photographers and most of all nature lovers with appreciation for the environment and willing to take responsible, nature-friendly action.

We have already discovered 4 species of birds either unknown or not recorded to the area, also a primate Red bald uakari that has had its natural habitat totally degraded by the hunting and logging industry in Peru, Besides this, the Uakaris are rare and threatened to extinction before we even know much about them--one of the most exotic animals in the rainforest, Also in the reserve there are Giant otters and Amazonian manatees, both highly endangered of extinction.

What we need and what for

We need a funding of US$10000 to build this tower. The project is divided in two phases,

Phase 1: about 2 months, finding the fallen logs and cutting into boards and ledgers, then transporting  to the building area

Phase 2: about 1 month, buying the metal parts bolts and metal joints, assembling the tower.


The tower will be buit from fallen hard wood, So we need the money for:

handcraft :

8 workers/month =US$1575.00 x 3 months = US$ 4721.00

food US$200/month x 3 months = US$600

metal parts US$ 2100.00

Fuel transport and saw US$ 1200,

The most expensive part of this project is cutting the wood where it has naturally fallen in the forest and bringng it to the building area. We have to look for dead trees all around the property rather than cutting living trees on the site. Transporting heavy hard wood in the jungle is not an easy task.

I assume we will make it, but in case we don't get the total funding we will apply existing funds to the first phase of the project.


The Impact

Our project is the very first of its kind in the region, and it has already created a great difference in the locals' lives, providing responsible alternative income. We not only create jobs, we prevent people from destroying the surroundings that most of the time is not even for their own benefit. Most of the families will work for the timber industry that pays close to nothing, teaches nothing, and destroys the environment where they live. Once there is no more wood, they are left with no job, no income and no natural resources .

This project is not just to create a tower but more importantly to create jobs for the long term that directly benefits the indigenous to the area and indirectly will preserve the Amazon.


Challenges

Being the first private conservation area in the zone means also we have many barriers to break. The timber industry is deeply rooted into the communities. Even though they are destructive, they provide a temporary solution that for the locals is better than nothing, and there are always attempts to invade the reserve for hunting and logging. With a lot of vigilence and effort over 4 years, we have minimised trespass nearly to nothing, but on and off there are attempts and the best way we have  to stop it is keeping people busy. For the past 16 months we have had great rewards watching the increase of wildlife numbers and better quality of life for the natives to the area.


Other way to help:

We need also volunteers to help in the construction, or surveilling the trails, lagoons and rivers. Tell your friends that might like to get involved in an Amazon project!

story:
My "Clear Water Dream"

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • My name is Dave Tieff, and most people know me as the lead singer of Laughing Colors. I'm a proud Marylander and I've lived near the Chesapeake Bay for over 30 years. It's always been my dream to create some kind of musical project that would help clean up the Chesapeake Bay, so when I got together with my old friend Rennie Grant from Colouring Lesson, we decided to do just that. Rennie is a talented guitarist and producer, so when I took my song "Clear Water Dream" to him our ideas starting flowing.
  • I've always been inspired by what "Band Aid" and "We Are The World" did for famine relief, so I thought, "why not get as many notable Maryland musicians as we can to benefit the Chesapeake?" The response has been nothing short of amazing. So far our biggest challenge will be how to include everyone!
  • I reached out to some of my heroes like John Palumbo (Crack the Sky) and Steve Whiteman (Kix) and Rob Fahey (The Ravyns), then my friends Kelly Bell (Kelly Bell Band) and Jimi Haha (Jimmie's Chicken Shack) and John Allen (Charm Cit Devils) and Mitch Allan (SR-71), and then the next generation of great Maryland artists like Julie Cymek (Sweet Leda), Joey Harkum (Pasadena) and Brandon Hardesty (Bumpin Uglies)--and EVERYONE wanted to get on board! Like I said, the response has been overwhelming.
What We Need & What You Get
  • We are seeking $25,000 to absorb the costs of studio time, recording, video shoot and production, promotion, and other expenses. We estimate this initial cost to be approximately $10,000, while the remaining $15,000 will go directly to The Chesapeake Baysavers (www.chesapeakebaysavers.org). Once the song and video are completed, this will also help to launch the "Clear Water Dream  Campaign" for awareness and funding, in partnership with the Chesapeake Bay Savers. Any future proceeds from the song and video will also go to benefit the Chesapeake Bay Savers.
  • By contributing $25, you not only play a HUGE role in helping to clean up the Chesapeake Bay and raise awareness, but you'll receive a downloadable album with some of Maryland's best known artists of the past and present. Contribute $100--and you can be IN THE VIDEO! How great to see your smiling face with a legendary group of artists? Contribute $500 and you can be in the video and enjoy a VIP front row seat to the recording of "Clear Water Dream" at Wright Way Studios, where you will meet all of the artists and get a specially signed poster.
  • If for any reason we do not reach our goal, we will still use whatever funds we've raised to record the song and video.

The Impact

If you live or grew up anywhere near the Chesapeake Bay region of Maryland, you know how important the Bay is to the livelihood, economy, and lives of all Marylanders. It is truly the heart and soul of the Free State. This is what the Chesapeake Bay Savers are all about:

Chesapeake BaySavers is a non-profit organization founded in Annapolis, Maryland whose mission is to bring health and restoration back to the Chesapeake Bay through advocacy and grassroots. Our immediate focus is to restore the Bay’s oyster population, but our mission includes restoration of all the Bay’s natural resources. The Chesapeake BaySavers hope to encourage a diverse population of Maryland residents to become stewards of a healthy Chesapeake Bay through hands on education and outreach programs. In conjunction with those efforts the Chesapeake BaySavers promotes legislation to create meaningful resource management initiatives.



**I share a mutual respect and admiration for Pete Seeger with my friend from the Chesapeake Bay Savers, Evan Thalenberg. Mr.Seeger just passed away on January 27th, 2014, but his music and his "Hudson River Sloop Clearwater" organization are also an inspiration for this song and this project.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute, that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Please share this link on Facebook, Twitter, social media, email, etc
  • Even if you can't contribute monetarily, spreading the word helps tremendously. This is a total collaborative grass roots effort!


Current Sponsors

story:
What We Need Right Now

Phase 1 of creating the Runamuk's pollinator and sustainable living center involves cleaning up this abandoned farm, reclaiming the first of many pastures, and expanding our farm to better serve our community.

Fencing Materials

  • Electric fencing for goats and pigs - 4000 feet of high-tensile electric wire costs $100 at our local Tractor Supply.  We need a minimum of 2 spools.  $200 total.

  • Starter herd of goats, and first pigs to the farm - our little trimmers and tillers! $650

  • Solar fence charger at Tractor Supply - roughly $300 total.

  • Insulators for 2 acres - $7.99 for a bag of 25 at Tractor Supply.  We need a minimum of 208 insulators--so 9 bags; totaling $72.

Equipment & Tools

  • Pump and hoses at Home Depot for moving water for garden irrigation and livestock watering.  Roughly $400.
  • Irrigation kit (1000ft) at Johnny's Seeds for maintaining the gardens.  Total $179.
  • Dumpster rental - $550.
  • 6-Row Seeder - for more efficient planting of our expanding market garden.  At Johnny's Seeds for $595.
  • Broadfork - because we believe in reducing soil disturbance in order to promote healthier microbial life in our gardens.  At Johnny's Seeds - $199.

Fees & Shipping

The remainder of the funds raised will go toward shipping costs and Indiegogo's fees.

What is Runamuk Acres?

This fencing is just the beginning for us.  It's going to allow us to reclaim this farm so that we can expand our gardens, increase our impact on our community by offering pasture-raised meats, and begin work on creating our pollinator conservation and sustainable living center.

Because Runamuk is more than just your ordinary farm.  Ultimately the goal for Runamuk is to create a pollinator conservation and sustainable living center here in the northeast.  Our passion for wildlife and our desire to live sustainably on the land is evident in every aspect of our farm plans, and by focusing our conservation efforts on native pollinators as a keystone species we’re able to do the greatest good for the environment.

Located in central Maine, for the last 4 years Runamuk has been a micro-farm on 1-acre serving the people of Madison-Anson and surrounding communities in Somerset County.  We produce heirloom seedlings grown without bee-threatening pesticides, fresh produce offered through our CSA, raw honey, and all natural beeswax products like soap, and herbal salves.  We practice sustainable farming methods and are certified bee-friendly by the Pollinator Partnership.

Runamuk is active in our local communities as an advocate for pollinator conservation and sustainable living, along with beekeeping and local farming and food.  Samantha is a certified Master Gardener with the University of Maine's Somerset Cooperative extension and president of the Somerset Beekeepers, and as an extension volunteer she teaches the annual bee-school, and can often be found speaking to local groups about beekeeping or pollinator conservation.  Leader of Madison's local 4H group, and manager of the Madison Farmers' Market, Samantha is working to increase accessibility of locally grown foods in the Madison-Anson area.  As a writer, Samantha shares her knowledge and experience on the Runamuk blog, and also in local publications such as the county's Master Gardener newsletter, and The Bee-Line--a bi-monthly publication from the Maine State Beekeepers' Association.

In December 2013 we moved our family and farm to 50-acres just outside of town where we are in the process of expanding our farm to better meet the needs of the community we serve, but first we need to clean the place up and reclaim the over-grown pastures!

This year, goats, pigs, and chickens are lined up to move to Runamuk at it's new location.  We will use the livestock to gently work the land, reclaiming the forgotten pastures and at the same time expanding our product line to offer pasture-raised meats to our customers.  Next year we plan to add sheep to the mix.  One pasture at a time we will bring this old farm back to life.

The Runamuk Acres Farm and Apiary will be a place where the public can come to learn about pollinators--with wildflower meadows and bee-pastures, native bee nesting sites, walking paths and hiking trails, a picnic area, and an education center for holding workshops related to pollinator conservation, beekeeping, and sustainable living.

But first we need to reclaim this old farm!

In Return for Your Generous Donations We're Offering:

In exchange for your support you'll receive your undying gratitude and appreciation, but we're also offering a number of our fantabulous products and some great perks!

  • $5 - Level 1: Sprout - Our gratitude and appreciation, along with a thank you email and a shout-out on facebook.
  • $10 - Level 2: Seedling - A social shout-out, your name on our sponsors' page on our website, a handwritten thank-you note with our excellent Herbal Beeswax Lipbalm.
  • $25 - Level 3: Gardener - Along with the items from level 2, we will send you 2 of our all-natural beeswax soaps (your choice), a small arsenal of wildflower seed-bombs so that you can help create habitat for native pollinators in your area.
  • $50 - Level 4: Activist - With a thank-you note, our herbal lipbalm, you can choose a variety of 4 of our fantastic beeswax soaps, you'll get the wildflower seed-bombs for promoting pollinator habitat, and we'll send you one of our hand-crafted herbal salves to try.
  • $75 - Level 5: Local Conservationist - For donating to our cause, you'll get all of the items from level 4, and you'll receive a Farmers' Market Loyalty card--which you can use to purchase any produce or products we have to offer at the Madison Farmers' Market during the market season.  This offer is for locals only.
  • $75 - Level 5: Conservationist - For conservationists not local to the Madison-Anson area, you can still receive the items from level 4, 2 loaves of Sam's awesome Honey-Wheat-Oatmeal bread and, once the spring honey-crop is harvested, we will send you 1-pound of our raw honey.
  • $100 - Level 6: Environmentalist - When you donate at this level, you will not only receive the items from level 5 (depending on your locality), but also a pound of our organically grown garlic, your choice of 6 of our beeswax soaps, 3 herbal salves of your choice, not 1-but 2--pounds of our incredible raw honey, and a dozen seed-bombs so that you can help us in our mission to promote pollinator habitat and conservation.
  • $200 or more - Level 7: Pollinator Hero - Become a "Pollinator Hero" and you will receive the rewards from level 6, and what's more--we will designate one of our hives in your honor!  You will receive an "Adopt-a-Hive" certificate, and you get to name the Queen!

If we don't reach our goal, we will do what we can with what we do receive.  Fencing will be a priority, without a dumpster we will do what we can to work on removal of the old farmhouse and other debris.

However if we are so fortunate as to raise more funds than the minimum goal we've set, we will use those funds to invest in portable electric-net fencing to further improve our ability to rotate livestock and reclaim over-grown pastures, more beekeeping equipment, or other useful tools for our farm's expansion.

Other Ways You Can Help

We completely understand that some people just can’t contribute, but you can still support our mission to expand our farm, and help us promote pollinator conservation and sustainable living.

  • Follow Runamuk Acres on Facebook, Pinterest, Google+, Instagram or Twitter.
  • Help spread the work by sharing! Tweet about our campaign, post a link on Facebook or Google+, email your friends to let them know about our great cause!
  • Subscribe to our blog or our seasonal farm-newsletter.

And thank you so much for just reading more about what we're doing!

healthier microbial life in our gardens.  At Johnny's Seeds - $199.
Fees & ShippingThe remainder of the funds raised will go toward shipping costs and Indiegogo's fees.What is Runamuk Acres?
This fencing is just the beginning for us.  It's going to allow us to reclaim this farm so that we can expand our gardens, increase our impact on our community by offering pasture-raised meats, and begin work on creating our pollinator conservation and sustainable living center.Because Runamuk is more than just your ordinary farm.  Ultimately the goal for 
Runamuk is to create a pollinator conservation and sustainable living 
center here in the northeast.  Our passion for wildlife and our desire 
to live sustainably on the land is evident in every aspect of our farm 
plans, and by focusing our conservation efforts on native pollinators as
 a keystone species we’re able to do the greatest good for the 
environment.Located in central Maine, for the last 4 years Runamuk has been a micro-farm on 1-acre serving the people of Madison-Anson and surrounding communities in Somerset County.  We produce heirloom seedlings grown without bee-threatening pesticides, 
fresh produce offered through our CSA, raw honey, and all natural beeswax 
products like soap, and herbal salves.  We practice sustainable farming methods and are certified bee-friendly by the Pollinator Partnership.Runamuk is active in our local communities as an advocate for pollinator
 conservation and sustainable living, along with beekeeping and local 
farming and food.  Samantha is a certified Master Gardener with the 
University of Maine's Somerset Cooperative extension and president of 
the Somerset Beekeepers, and as an extension volunteer she teaches the annual bee-school, and can often  be
 found speaking to local groups about beekeeping or pollinator 
conservation.  Leader of Madison's local 4H group, and manager of the 
Madison Farmers' Market, Samantha is working to increase accessibility 
of locally grown foods in the Madison-Anson area.  As a writer, Samantha
 shares her knowledge and experience on the Runamuk blog, and also in 
local publications such as the county's Master Gardener newsletter, and 
The Bee-Line--a bi-monthly publication from the Maine State Beekeepers' 
Association.In December 2013 we moved our family and farm to 50-acres just outside 
of town where we are in the process of expanding our farm to better meet
 the needs of the community we serve, but first we need to clean the place up and reclaim the over-grown pastures!This year, goats, pigs, and chickens are lined up to move to Runamuk at it's new location.  We will use the livestock to gently work the land, reclaiming the forgotten pastures and at the same time expanding our product line to offer pasture-raised meats to our customers.  Next year we plan to add sheep to the mix.  One pasture at a time we will bring this old farm back to life. The Runamuk Acres Farm and Apiary will be a place where the public can come to learn about pollinators--with wildflower meadows and bee-pastures, native bee nesting sites, walking paths and 
hiking trails, a picnic area, and an education center for holding workshops related to pollinator conservation, beekeeping, and sustainable living.But first we need to reclaim this old farm!In Return for Your Generous Donations We're Offering:
In exchange for your support you'll receive your undying gratitude and appreciation, but we're also offering a number of our fantabulous products and some great perks!
$5 - Level 1: Sprout - Our gratitude and appreciation, along with a thank you email and a shout-out on facebook.
$10 - Level 2: Seedling - A social shout-out, your name on our sponsors' page on our website, a handwritten thank-you note with our excellent Herbal Beeswax Lipbalm.
$25 - Level 3: Gardener - Along with the items from level 2, we will send you 2 of our all-natural beeswax soaps (your choice), a small arsenal of wildflower seed-bombs so that you can help create habitat for native pollinators in your area.
$50 - Level 4: Activist - With a thank-you note, our herbal lipbalm, you can choose a variety of 4 of our fantastic beeswax soaps, you'll get the wildflower seed-bombs for promoting pollinator habitat, and we'll send you one of our hand-crafted herbal salves to try.
$75 - Level 5: Local Conservationist - For donating to our cause, you'll get all of the items from level 4, and you'll receive a Farmers' Market Loyalty card--which you can use to purchase any produce or products we have to offer at the Madison Farmers' Market during the market season.  This offer is for locals only.
$75 - Level 5: Conservationist - For conservationists not local to the Madison-Anson area, you can still receive the items from level 4, 2 loaves of Sam's awesome Honey-Wheat-Oatmeal bread and, once the spring honey-crop is harvested, we will send you 1-pound of our raw honey.
$100 - Level 6: Environmentalist - When you donate at this level, you will not only receive the items from level 5 (depending on your locality), but also a pound of our organically grown garlic, your choice of 6 of our beeswax soaps, 3 herbal salves of your choice, not 1-but 2--pounds of our incredible raw honey, and a dozen seed-bombs so that you can help us in our mission to promote pollinator habitat and conservation.
$200 or more - Level 7: Pollinator Hero - Become a "Pollinator Hero" and you will receive the rewards from level 6, and what's more--we will designate one of our hives in your honor!  You will receive an "Adopt-a-Hive" certificate, and you get to name the Queen!

If we don't reach our goal, we will do what we can with what we do receive.  Fencing will be a priority, without a dumpster we will do what we can to work on removal of the old farmhouse and other debris.However if we are so fortunate as to raise more funds than the minimum goal we've set, we will use those funds to invest in portable electric-net fencing to further improve our ability to rotate livestock and reclaim over-grown pastures, more beekeeping equipment, or other useful tools for our farm's expansion.Other Ways You Can HelpWe completely understand that some people just can’t contribute, but you can still support our mission to expand our farm, and help us promote pollinator conservation and sustainable living.
Follow Runamuk Acres on Facebook, Pinterest, Google+, Instagram or Twitter.

Help spread the work by sharing! Tweet about our campaign, post a link on Facebook or Google+, email your friends to let them know about our great cause!

Subscribe to our blog or our seasonal farm-newsletter.
And thank you so much for just reading more about what we're doing!

story:
Who We Are 

Nature Nurtures Farm brings young people and animals together to build empathy, teach responsibility, and inspire hope.

We serve both youth and animals in need. Our nonprofit farm is a lifelong home and sanctuary to more than 100 rescued farm animals. Youth who are experiencing challenging life circumstances participate in our mentoring program, after-school program, summer camps, and volunteer opportunities caring for animals.

Young people with emotional challenges often respond to animals in ways they can’t, or won't, to fellow humans. These bonds elicit a nurturing, empathetic instinct. Learning to properly care for and understand animals develops a sense of responsibility and pride. A child whose trust was shattered by a person is far more likely to risk friendship with an animal because the animal does not ask questions, doesn't judge, and never shares his or her secrets. Animals then help to bridge communication with caring adults, forming emotional skills that lead to healthy relationships.


Why We Need You

We are committed to continuing to serve the youth and animals who need us, but we can't do it without your help. To abide by strict county regulations, we recently learned that we will need to acquire a "special use permit" -- and to get that permit we will have to complete some costly upgrades to our facility. What little revenue we generate through annual summer camps keeps our youth mentoring program afloat; without the permit, we'll no longer be able to offer these camps. So we're in a pretty tough spot.

If we can't afford to complete the upgrades required by the county, we are faced with the unthinkable prospect of having to walk away from our life's work.

What We Need

We need a total of approximately $29,000, broken down as follows:

  • $7,700: "Special use permit" fee
  • $990: Pre-submission conference
  • $4,020: SEPA State Environmental Review
  • $5,000-$7,000: Cost to drill a new well. (We're really hoping they don't have to go terribly deep! This cost could go up considerably if they have to drill a lot deeper than is typical for our area.)
  • $4,000: Engineering services for public water system, parking, and site drainage
  • $3,000: Septic design services
  • $2,600: Indiegogo and Paypal fees, perk fulfillment

Any and all funds raised will go toward the costs detailed above. If we don't meet our fundraising goal, we'll have no choice but to pull funds from our day-to-day operating budget, which will mean cutting skilled, caring staff members and perhaps ceasing our youth mentoring program -- the lifeblood of what we do -- entirely.

If we surpass our goal, we'll use any additional funds to expand our mentoring and after-school programs to serve more youth in need. 

Our History

Nature Nurtures Farm, the life's vision of Nicole Peters, was founded and incorporated in April 2012. Modeled after the successful Green Chimneys program in New York, Nature Nurtures Farm offers a diverse array of programs designed to bring children and animals together for educational and emotionally beneficial experiences.

During summer of 2013, Nature Nurtures Farm welcomed a total of 197 children for farm and horse day camps, run primarily by volunteers. We have nearly three dozen young people enrolled in our mentoring program who struggle with social, emotional, or behavioral difficulties.

Your Impact

The programs offered at Nature Nurtures Farm promote and strengthen children's emotional health and family relationships. Nature Nurtures Farm is dedicated to providing educational, therapeutic, and recreational services to youth and families in a safe and peaceful environment that fosters dignity, compassion, and respect for all living things. Most programs offer extensive opportunities for participants to interact with the farm's many rescued animals.

Your donation will help ensure that we can continue to serve the young people who count on us and the animals we care for.

What You Get

We're offering some super rewards for certain donation levels! Check out the list directly to your right. Questions about our perks? Just email them to: info@naturenurturesfarm.org

*Please note: We are a licensed nonprofit in the state of Washington and have submitted our 501c3 application; the IRS is in the process of reviewing it. This qualifies us as a provisional tax-exempt nonprofit, which means we can offer you a tax-deductible donation receipt even though we are not a "verified nonprofit" through Indiegogo. Please let us know if you would like us to issue you one, or if you have any questions.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're not able to contribute financially, you can still help!

  • Share our campaign with your social network via Facebook, Twitter, and email. Talk about us with your friends and coworkers. The more people who know we need help, the better our chances of receiving it.
  • It's easy to share our campaign with Indiegogo's share options!

Other Ways You Can Help
If you're not able to contribute financially, you can still help!

Share our campaign with your social network via Facebook, Twitter, and email. Talk about us with your friends and coworkers. The more people who know we need help, the better our chances of receiving it.
It's easy to share our campaign with Indiegogo's share options!

story:
Short Summary

Furthering marine conservation in developing is incredibly important for global and local conservation, local economies and more. This campaign is to to help sponsor delegates from developing countries to attend the International Marine Conservation Congress (IMCC), so they can bring back knowledge, skills and tools to further marine conservation in their countries, as well as present marine conservation issues and projects to marine scientists from around the world.

The Society for Conservation Biology's IMCCs are the most important international meetings for marine conservation professionals and students. To conserve the world’s oceans we must go beyond science, and use it to inform policy and management, and ultimately to catalyze change. IMCC brings together conservation professionals and students to develop new and powerful tools to further marine conservation science and policy.

What We Need & What You Get

All funds received from this campaign will be used to help sponsor travel for students and marine conservationists from developing countries to attend IMCC3, 14-18 August 2014. IMCC3 will be held in Glasgow, Scotland.

The Impact

IMCC provides tangible outcomes in the advancement of marine science and marine conservation. Delegates from developing countries who attend IMCC make important contacts with international organizations who may help further their work, gain knowledge of successful marine conservation strategies, gain skills and access to tools to help marine conservation in their countries and present on issues and stories from their countries to make public their needs and efforts.

Improving marine conservation impacts many facets of life. In many developing countries, as well as others, improving marine conservation also leads to the betterment of public health issues, better management of fisheries leading to increased access to food sources, improved local and national economies, job creation and more. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Share this campaign with friends, family and colleagues!

story:
Bali's Anti Littering Campaign

Bali Indonesia is facing an environmental disaster from Plastic Trash. Trash is everywhere, In the Streets, Rivers, Rice Fields, and Beaches.
With a large population and lack of education about littering, The island is becoming swamped by plastic. Monsoonal rains flush the trash from the island and into the sea. Some trash returns to the Beaches but much remains in the Ocean creating havoc for sea life.

Tas Pasar in an charity which focuses on reducing plastic bags in Bali. We are currently raising funds to play a 30 second TV commercial on prime time Bali TV.
The target is to show the commercial every evening for 1 year which will require funds of $10,000.

30 seconds air time is only $30 .

Other Ways You Can Help

Please follow our campaign to clean Bali on facebook.

https://www.facebook.com/TasPasar
