story:
MAGGIE The A-bomb Bus is BUSted!!

And we need you to help free her from the Tow yard. (more like P.O.W. yard)

but first, an introduction and brief history...
Hi, I am Kam, the Commander of this whole operation. I am a drummer/songwriter/skateboarder/filmmaker/activist in Hollywood, and I have been working on a documentary called Peace, Love, and A-bombs, to inspire the creation of global Food Forestry through militant mobilization. 
Check out Beacon Food Forest in Seattle for successful urban food forestry looks like:

Beacon Urban Food Forest, Seattle

Two years ago, it was an Avocado food forest that nearly saved my life.
Rudolf Hass' original grove in La Habra to be exact...

The avocado, abundance bomb, or "A-bomb" for short, was a portal to a world of abundance. It is the most calorically and nutrient dense food on the planet, and it grows everywhere out here in Cali. Ironically, the "A-bomb" represents the power of produce in the palm of our hands, because within every delicious fruit, we can create MORE. Here is more on that subject in an interview I did for EveryMondayMatters:

 Not only did fruit provide my sustenance when I was foraging for food as a starving touring musician in Los Angeles, but it cured my scarcity syndrome, by giving me a gift to give: it's seed. 

So, I foraged fruit to share with everyone and started growing and planting avocados everywhere in Los Angeles.... with a militant mindset. I realized the only way to create food forestry on a large scale was to mobilize like war. 

This is Richard foraging with the AA. He is from Liberia, and was attacked by child soldiers as a child, and has the scars to prove it. Needless to say he loves the idea of peace through food forestry... and the neighbors loved it so much they gave him a T.V. too!

This is a silly video of me starting to grow the first seeds from the Hass grove! (its when I wasn't too good at film making ;)


This is a planting at the Hollywood sign. Some awesome tourists from Egypt stepped in, and just before the cops showed up ;)

So now onto...

The Avocado Army

My project, Avocado Army, is an L.A. based lifestyle movement and brand in support of Food Forestry. Food Forestry is believed to be the model for the future of sustainable agriculture.

Our movement implements this model through urban agriculture as a communal effort with a fun militant mindset. Our brand, centered around the iconic "A-bomb" (avocado bomb), the most energy abundant food source on earth, represents the abundant power of produce in our hands to wage a peaceful war on scarcity through food forestry. The hippy soldier twist gets people involved and having fun doing it!

Avo Army merchandise, multimedia, school programs and community events will raise awareness and implement Food Forestry at the community level. At a global level, we want to repurpose the military for Food Forest production. The Avo Army hopes to initiate our armed forces in global desert re-food-forestation projects. Until then, we live this truth and pave the way through our community efforts.

The next step in this 2 year passion project is to build the A-bomb bus, the Avo Army headquarters for all operations, and launch our brand.

                               

Maggie the A-Bomb Bus

Last year, I bought a bus from hippies in Vegas, and started designing with my friends at GUILD to be the Avo Army mobile headquarters. Think Electric Koolaid Acid Test meets Saving Private Ryan.  It will have the following functionalities:

  • A greenhouse to grow trees and teach the process through youtube media and school programs
  • A tree planting party bus, to make food forestry fun; flash mob guerrilla garden style.
  • A headquarters and mobile barracks for research and development
  • An event space for festivals and outreach.
  • A mobile Surplus Store and Finger Foods restaurant to fund our efforts
  • everything solar and bio-deisel.

How you can join us...

Your contribution will help us secure maggie safely with us, cover some of the damage and provide temporary storage until we find something permanent, so this doesn't happen again. We can buy maggie back from Howard Sommers tow yard after 4/20, which is significant, because it's Easter, Green Day, 2 days before Earth day, and Avocado Army's birthday. And a Free Maggie would be the best birthday ever!!!!

Anything we raise above 10k will go to the A-Bomb Bus BUILDOUT, and establishing our brand to plant trees and Food Forests in a 1 for 1 kind of fashion... so keep it coming after we hit the goal and we will keep planting and creating even more incentives.

We are working with our friends at Neon Roots to create a business plan, app design, School programs, to make planting Food Forests in Los Angeles super effective, so extra is great.

Incentives...

For your contribution, you join us by receiving your rank in the Avo Army. You can also get some A-bomb Apparel swag from our Surplus Store printed on lovely eco tees from our friends at Alternative Apparel.

Rep the Army and we will donate trees in your honor!!!

Other Ways You Can Help

Share!!! Help us find people that can help us.

If you have other ideas to help, email me at Kam@avocadoarmy.com

Here is a list of some other needs...

  • A space to park the bus (in Los Angeles area)
  • Volunteer interest
  • Public places to grow food forests
  • Avocado trees and groves

Thank you for your support, and your service...

...souljah ;)

Hoorah!

Help us find people that can help us.If you have other ideas to help, email me at Kam@avocadoarmy.comHere is a list of some other needs...
A space to park the bus (in Los Angeles area)
Volunteer interest

Avocado trees and groves
Thank you for your support, and your service......souljah ;)Hoorah!

story:
Students Helping Kahoolawe

Hui Malama Na Mea a Kane is a project-based learning program for middle school students at Hawaii Academy of Arts & Sciences charter school in rural Puna, Hawaii. We're a public school that represents our diverse, vibrant community.  We do a lot of community work as well as environmental work. This campaign is important to us because we really want to help a sacred island in the heart of the Hawaiian Islands named Kahoolawe.

Nine students from our program and two instructors are thrilled to have the rare opportunity to actually go to Kahoolawe and help with restoration.  We will be working long, hard days, planting native plants, learning about the history of the island, and learning about the cultural importance of Kahoolawe to the Hawaiian people.

Our work on the island will not only benefit the restoration efforts and the nine students going.  Our students will be forever imprinted with a life-changing experience.  They will serve as Lifetime Ambassadors for Kahoolawe, teaching out to their peers and younger students about this treasure for all people in Hawaii Nei.  The students will create presentations for our community at large, as well.

Your donation, big, small, or anywhere in between, supports this dedicated group of kids and shows them their enthusiasm is valuable and appreciated.  Show them the world cares, too!

 

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal of $2500. in donations from this Indiegogo campaign, along with money the students are earning from car washes, bake sales, movie nights, etc., will:

  • purchase round-trip interisland airfare for the students
  • purchase t-shirts designed by the students to show unity and pride
  • purchase work gloves and other small equipment our economically students have difficulty in buying themselves

Even if we don't reach our funding goal here on Indiegogo, we're not giving up!  All money donated to this campaign will go to our trip to Kahoolawe and nothing else.  Every little bit helps!

 

The Impact

This island we are wishing to help restore is very important to all the people of Hawaii, and especially to native Hawaiians.  Your donation supports the legacy of many organizations, grass roots groups, individuals and cultural heroes who have struggled to maintain the dignity and living culture of the Hawaiian people.  If you have ever felt the desire to right a wrong, make a difference, be a part of the change, then this is a great opportunity.

Hui Malama students have a long-standing tradition of making a real difference when we take on a project.  Please go to http://huimalama.weebly.com/environmental-stewardship-projects-2012-13.html to learn more.

"The future is our youth" isn't just a catchy phrase for Hui Malama.  We live by that idea, and we consider it our job to give our youth the opportunities they deserve.  Your donation keeps our future going!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Get the word out and make some noise about this campaign
  • Share on Facebook, Twitter, and any other social network you use
  • Are you a member of a list serve?  Send out the word!

story:
Working in the Amazon

Hi my name is Paul Rosolie. For the past several years I have worked in southeast Peru with a local naturalist named Juan Julio Durand to protect rainforest. We have done this by opening our doors to travelers from all over the world. People come and get to see the amazing wildlife of the Amazon, and help to protect the jungle they experience. We accomplish our mission of safeguarding wildlife by operating a research station or lodge on a tributary of the Madre de Dios River. Please check out a link about the work that we do here and also here. 

Having our lodge allows us to accommodate visitors, who make it possible to protect the forest. People who join us in the forest are not tourists, they are helping to protect our land with us; these are Junglekeepers.

Our research station is a beautiful and serene place located in the middle of hundreds of miles of jungle. However in the last two years our job has not been easy. We have fought off poachers, loggers, and other invaders, and even come close to altogether losing our land and the station. Protecting rainforest out on the Amazon frontier is no easy task. While we have been struggling to keep the forest protected our research station has fallen into disrepair. The palm-thatched roof has developed holes that let in rain. If rain continues to fall onto the floor of the station the wood will rot and we will no longer be able to accommodate visitors and protect the forest. This is what we need your help to fix.

 We want to replace the palm-thatch roof with stronger, more durable corrugated steel. This will keep our station safe and running, and make it possible for us to continue protecting our preserve and the millions and millions of creatures within it.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need to raise $9,500 before the start of the rainy season (approximately Nov. 15). The money raised will go towards materials, transportation, and labor to fix our roof as soon as possible, before it starts raining!
  • This is no ordinary ‘donate to a cause’ campaign. We are inviting you to become a part of our Junglekeeper team. We want everyone who contributes and supports us to actually come visit us in the rainforest and see the outcome of his or her contribution. We are giving away free trips, t-shirts, books, photos and more!  
  • Everyone who donates to this campaign, no matter what the amount, will have their names added to a plaque that will be installed at the research station, to make sure that people for decades to come appreciate what you did!

The Impact

  • The loss of life on our planet has been called the ‘defining issue of our time’, and we are alive at a time in history when there is still so much left to save. Today the western Amazon is the largest area of intact rainforest habitat on Earth. It is the most biodiverse place that has ever existed, ever. That means that there are more species of plant and animals there than anywhere else. It holds the world records for birds, butterflies, dragonflies, and amphibians. Our research station protect species like endangered macaws, jaguars, spider monkeys, howler monkeys (and 10 other monkeys), giant anteaters, sloth, anaconda, black caiman, and thousands more.
  • In the last few years we have caught loggers red handed, rescued species captured by poachers, and maintained a sanctuary where wildlife can exist in peace. People from Australia, Finland, the US, UK, India, France, England, Canada, South Africa, and other places have joined us in the field to be a part of the team. By helping us fix the roof you’ll be allowing this special project to continue growing.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please remember that even small donations help us achieve our goal, but we understand that some people really can’t contribute. Please remember that:

We need help making as much noise about this as possible. Share the IndieGogo Page with ten of your friends on Facebook, or Twitter, help us get the message out! Check out the Indie Gogo share tools. Also talk to friends and family about our mission! Lets do this together!

Please remember that even small donations help us achieve our goal, but we understand that some people really can’t contribute. Please remember that:
We need help making as much noise about this as possible. Share the IndieGogo Page with ten of your friends on Facebook, or Twitter, help us get the message out! Check out the Indie Gogo share tools. Also talk to friends and family about our mission! Lets do this together!

story:
We are SEED, a 12 year old Non Profit and Public Benefits Organisation that has been pioneering the growing of Outdoor Classrooms in under resourced schools across South Africa. Through the important work of connecting children to the ecosystems that support them and bringing the miracle of food into curriculum and tummies of children, we have found that our work addresses climate change, job creation and career pathing, social cohesion and food security.

 

We are now growing Rocklands Urban Abundance Centre as an integrated teaching and demonstration centre that has a wide educational reach. The first Community Enterprise is already growing Gourmet Mushrooms for Pick n Pay and we plan to grow the Education systems up as the next enterprise.

THIS DONATION

South Africans please do not be scared of donating in dollars - this is an international platform and the dollars are standard. We do offer tax exemption (Section18A) certificates for all donations.

 

WHAT IS PERMACULTURE?

Permaculture a sustainable living and design science rooted in observation of nature; permaculture is to sustainability what math is to physics.  Nature has long solved many of the environmental and social problems we're facing today, but we just have not been paying much attention.

We seek to build an earth sensitive classroom that enables the growth of the education systems at Rocklands. We need $50 000 to build our classroom.

The process of building will be used to skill up locals and employ them to build.

We have already built the first two buildings at Rocklands Urban Abundance Centre:

The Post Carbon Homestead Model

The Outdoor Classroom

Rocklands Urban Abundace Centre has ALREADY been awarded a Deutsche Bank Urban Age Award and is shortlisted for the World Design Capital 2014.

Please help us to go to the next level. We are already teaching: teachers, learners, caretakers and running tours from Rocklands.

We plan to offer the following trainings: Permaculture Design Courses, Youth Career Pathing for the Green Economy, Home Gardening, Mushroom Cultivation and more.

 

Please MAKE A NOISE about our campaign and spread the word.

story:
Short Summary

21 year old Sevak Simonian has been missing for approximately 2 weeks in a remote national park about 150km to the west of Sydney.

Sevak left his Belrose home in Sydney's north at 8pm on Monday 20 October, 2014. His car was located at the Kanangra Walls carpark on Friday 24th October and, despite an extremely extensive search coordinated by police, he remains missing.

We are looking for donations, small or large, over the next 2-3 days to contribute extra resources to the search. For example, helicopter time doesn't come cheap - in excess of $5000/hour - so that's our initial goal. I'd love to see the public donate enough for 1 extra hour of helicopter search time.

Small and medium donations are absolutely welcome - please give just $5 to help professional search and rescue organisations to do their work!

Why I've Started This Campaign

My name is Rob Malicki and I have been a proud member of a search and rescue squad for about a decade. I have spent 3 days in the mountains as part of the search over the past 8 days.

Sevak is from the suburb next to where I live and, whilst up in the mountains, I met his parents Rosa and Massis. Words can't describe their courage and how much they have personally contributed to helping all the volunteers and officials working on the search at Kanangra.

I'm now tied up at work and can't get back up to the mountains, but still want to contribute to the effort. I've been inspired by others that have made donations and wanted to create a place for everyone who's read about the search for Sevak a chance to contribute something on top of the huge efforts from the volunteers and search personnel. 


What We Need

Sevak has been missing for about two weeks now, so it is a critical time.

Police, emergency and volunteer search agencies have invested significant resources in the search so far. Further private funds would be a big advantage in order to help fund further search activities, like helicopter time for searching or getting people into and out of remote search areas. 

Helicopter time doesn't come cheap - in excess of $5000/hour - so that's my initial goal. I'd love to see the public donate enough for 1 extra hour of helicopter search time.

All funds raised will be donated on a daily basis to the Bushwalkers Wilderness Rescue Squad (BWRS) and/or Volunteer Rescue Association (VRA) of NSW to be used as those agencies as they see fit - however, please note that this is not an official campaign of either of these agencies and is not officially endorsed.

If you are more comfortable, I'd encourage you to donate directly to Bushwalkers Wilderness Rescue at http://bwrs.org.au/?q=fundraising
BWRS is an independent organisation, so will use any donations as they see fit, both for this operation or future work. BWRS has not endorsed this public crowd funding campaign.

Media Links

Below are links to a few media pieces about the search.

  • http://www.smh.com.au/nsw/bosses-should-give-workers-time-off-to-search-for-missing-sydney-man-sevak-simonian-dick-smith-20141029-11dkae.html
  • http://www.abc.net.au/news/2014-10-27/police-search-for-a-missing-bushwalker-near-oberon-enters-its-t/5843078?&section=news
  • http://www.bluemountainsgazette.com.au/story/2666735/missing-hikers-shoes-gear-found-at-parents-home/?cs=12
  • http://www.dailytelegraph.com.au/news/nsw/sevak-simonian-a-survival-freak-12day-search-for-intensifies-after-reported-sighting-of-lone-bushwalker-30km-from-where-he-went-missing/story-fni0cx12-1227109035950 
Official media enquiries should be directed to NSW Police, not the campaign organiser.

story:
The start of thatching:



(Readers, more common to read English text, pls. see below)

Ein Reetdachhaus erfordert regelmäßige Instandhaltung / a thatched roof requires regular maintenance.

If not doing so:

and soon afterwards:




Für den deutschsprachigen Leser:

Die Herausforderung

Im  Jahr 1996 erwarb ich ein rohrgedecktes Fachwerkhaus in der Nähe von Greifswald, in einer Ortschaft, aus der meine Vorfahren stammen, deren Linie sich bis in das 17. Jahrhundert zurückverfolgen läßt.

Das Haus, bzw. teile seiner Grundsubstanz stammen aus der Mitte des 17. Jahrhunderts. Anlass zu dieser Annahme bieten eine schwedische 1/4 Öre Münze mit dem Datum 1635, die bei Aushubarbeiten am Grunde eines Schornsteins gefunden wurden,  und die Matrikelkarten der schwedischen Landesaufnahme Pommerns aus den Jahren 1692 bis 1709, in denen das Haus und Grundstück verzeichnet sind. Grundbucheintragungen liegen bis Anfang des 19. Jahrhunderst vor.

Das Haus ist mehrfach umgebaut und gegen 1820 mit einem neuen Dachstuhl versehen worden. Die Sparren, Zangen und Dachlatten sind mit Holznägeln verbunden, Metallnägel handgeschmiedet und gewähren die Verbindung der Gratsparren zum Fachwerk.



Als ich das Haus 1996 erwarb, bestand die Außenhaut aus Putz. Nach dem Entfernen des Putzes kam erschreckendes zu Tage. Das Fachwerk bestand z.g.T. Nadelholz und war durch und durch verrottet, einzelne Teile aus Eichenbalken, so ein Teil der Schwellen. Das Fachwerk in den Außenwänden war teilweise vollständig entfernt und durch ein Mix von Klinker und Betonsteinen ersetzt worden, eine Hausecke um über einen halben Meter abgesackt.

Einzig das Dach und die Decke mit den Deckenbalken waren i.O.!

Was tun? Wir haben das gesamte Dach einschl. Decke über eine Holzkonstruktion angehoben, sämtliches Fachwerk entfernt, neu fundamentiert und von versierten Zimmerern ein vollständig neues Eichenfachwerk in Handarbeit erstellen und errichten lassen. Ca. 20m^3 Eichenkantholz wurden verarbeitet.

Nun ist das Rohrdach fällig!


Das Rohrdach ist z.g.T. noch mit Haselnussruten gebunden, an den Giebeln wurde als untere Lage des Rohrdachs Stroh verwendet.  Zur Herstellung der Dachlatten hatten sich die früheren Dachdecker aus dem nahe gelegenen Wald bedient und roh behauene Stämme junger Bäume verwendet.

Die ältesten Teile des Dachs sind nach Aussagen erfahrener Rohdachdecker sicher über 80 Jahre alt, was für die Qualität der Arbeit und die Eignung des Materials Reet deutlich spricht.


Das Dach ist nun ein einigen Stellen undicht - regnet durch - und der First von Wind und Wetter zerzaust, d.h. das Dach muß dringend neu gedeckt werden.

Reet (auch: Reeth, Reth, Reith, Ried, Riet, Rohr und Ähnliches) bezeichnet das an Ufern oder auf sumpfigem Gelände wachsende Schilfrohr, das vielerorts in getrocknetem Zustand zur Dacheindeckung verwendet wird und in früheren Zeiten zu vielen ähnlichen Zwecken diente, so etwa zum Besticken neuer Deiche mit der Deichnadel.

Der Name Reetdach hat sich bundesweit für diese Eindeckungsform durchgesetzt, mitunter wird sie auch Rohrdach genannt.[1] Ein mit Reet gedecktes Haus wird auch als Reethaus bzw. Reethus bezeichnet.

Siehe auch Link zur Reetdachdeckerinnung

Die Unterstützung

Ich benötige nun in finanzieller, und gerne auch ergänzend in tatkräftiger Weise Unterstützung in diesem Vorhaben, da das Rohdach noch dieses Jahr neu gedeckt werden muß.


(gebundenes Weichdach: aktueller Zustand)


(genähtes Weichdach: zukünftiger Zustand)

Konkret muss das alte Rohr und die Dachlatten entfernt werden, teilweise verrottete Sparren ersetzt, das Dach neu verlattet und schlussendlich das Reet "aufgenäht" werden.


All das geschieht in aufwändiger Handarbeit und wird von lokal ansässigen Rohrdachdeckern ausgeführt.

Da ich auf jegliche Änderungen am Dach verzichte, beispielsweise keine neuen Gauben setzen lassen möchte, beziffern sich die Kosten auf 50.000 EUR.

Sollte das Gesamtziel des Fundings von EUR 50.000 nicht errecht werden, so werde ich mich nur in der Lage sehen, kritische Teile des Dachs reparieren zu lassen.


    Die Folgen

    Die Art des Deckens von Häusern unter der Verwendung von Reet/Schilf/Rohr war in Norddeutschland in früheren Zeiten weit verbreitet, das Material in geeigneter Qualität lokal gut verfügbar, Arbeitskraft preiswert und Hartdächer für viele Menschen unerschwinglich.

    In unserer heutigen Zeit verhält es sich geanu umgekehrt. Reetdächer sind heute einer der teuersten Arten um Häuser mit einem Dach zu versehen.

    Somit verschwanden - und verschwinden auch heute noch - Reetdächer und wurden/werden mit Ziegeln neu gedeckt. Vielen Häusern ist anzusehen, dass sie einst als Reetdachhaus entstanden und nun ein Hartdach ertragen müssen.

    Mein Ziel besteht unbedingt darin, das Kulturgut Reetdach am Beispiel meines Hauses weiterleben zu lassen.

    Dieses Bestreben liegt im Einklang mit meinen bisherigen Anstregungen, das Haus im ursprünglichen Erscheinungsbild, unter der Verwendung natürlicher Materialien und so weit als möglich in Handarbeit von lokalen Handwerkern neu entstehen zu lassen.


    Ergänzende Unterstüzung

    Ich würde mich sehr freuen, falls mein Anliegen von interessierten Lesern publik gemacht wird und ich eine breite Basis der Unterstützung erfahren werde.

    --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

    For Readers more common to read English text:

    The Challenge

    In the year 1996 I purchased a timbered house with a thatched roof in a village near by the town Greifswald, a small town in North East Germany, not far away from the Baltic Sea. Quite peculiar, that my  genealogy tree can be traced back into the 17th century, just into this village.

    This house, esp. it's base substance can be traced back into the 17th century. This information is supported by a 1/4 ore coin, dated 1635, found at the base of a chimney of the house.

    Additionally the site was cartographed by Swedish cartographers in the period from 1692 to 1709 ("Schwedische Landvermessung von Pommern").
    Entries in the land register can be traced back to the beginning of the 19th century.

    The house has been reconstructed and rebuild repeatedly over time. In the past it seems be be burned down completely, as a this ash layer beneath the floor is visible, found by me during the reconstruction of the floor in a depth of roundabout 1m.

    In 1820 the house got a completely new roof framework. The rafters and all other parts of the roof framework are mounted using wooden nails, the angle rafters has been mounted using hand forged nails.

    When I acquired the house in 1996 the walls were plastered, no timbers could be seen. After removing the plasters I found, that almost all wooden bars of the framework were heavily rotten. Partially no wooden bars were left but substituted simply by brickwork. One edge of the house was subsided more than a half meter.

    Only the thatched roof and the bars of the ceiling were ok.

    What to do? We lifted the complete roof, removed the wooden framework of the walls and reconstructed the framework using oak bars completely new, Roundabout 20m^3 oak bars were used.

    Now the thatched roof has to be completely reconstructed!

    The reeds covering the roof are mainly bound using hazlenut rods, in some places the reeds is underlayn by straw.

    The oldest parts of the roof are older than 80 years, an estimate done by experienced roofers. A long time for a roof, speaking for the quality of material used.

    Now the roof is leaky in some place - the roof needs to be reconstructed and rebuild asap!


    The Support


    I started this campain to find supporters for the reconstruction of the thatched roof.

    There is a lot of craftsmanship needed to reconstruct a thatched roof an can be done by experienced, local roofers only.

    The reconstruction has been estimated to 50.000 EUR.

    Will the taget amount of 50.000 EUR not be reached I'll only be able to repair critical parts.


    The Implications


    Covering homes by reeds was very common in previous centuries, widespread in the Netherlands, England, Northern German and a lot of other countries. Reeds was commonly available in good quality, the craftsmanship widespread. Covering homes with reeds was the cheapest way in those days.

    Today covering the roofs of homes is one of the most expensive kind.

    So thatched roofs vanished mostly and are still vanishing today to be covered by roof tiles.


    My approach is to beware these cultural assets! This is completely coincident with my past approaches to reconstruct this house using classical materials in it's original shape and conditions.

    Additional Support


    I'd appreciate very much if the reader - and hopefully supporter - of this campaign would distribute it's information widespread.

I'd appreciate very much if the reader - and hopefully supporter - of this campaign would distribute it's information widespread.

story:
With the City's Recycling Program Ending Reusable Bags Take on A Whole New Level of Importance in This Small Alaskan Town

Every year world-wide 1 trillion plastic bags are generated, 102.1 billion in the USA alone! Of all those bags, 11% are recycled. 10% end up in our oceans.

When you think of Alaska, what comes to mind? For many, it is vast untouched areas of unparalleled beauty and wilderness. Wild animals, Northern Lights, snow capped mountains, glaciers, extreme skiing, commercial fishing and maybe even a reality TV show. 

You would not be wrong. But there is something else. Something dirtier, darker. Due to the remoteness we all associate Alaska with, dealing with our garbage is a huge problem. Many communities burn it, others bury it. Recycling is difficult, costly and oftentimes logistically impossible. So much so, that the City of Cordova, Alaska recently decided to end the city's recycling program.

As devastating as that decision might be to the environment, the Eyak Preservation Council (EPC) decided to move into action; and to "make lemonade out of lemons" by implementing  a program to create and distribute eco-friendly, reusable cotton shopping bags, for free, to all Cordova residents!

Perks For Your Support

As our way of saying THANK YOU for helping our cause we have put together some great rewards for you! 
$ 2 - This sweet and playful salmon sticker!  

$ 5 - The sweet sticker and a personal thank you note from EPC Founder and one of Time Magazines "50 Heroes For the Planet", Dune Lankard. You'll also get Dune's famous salmon recipe.
$ 25 - A reusable canvas bag all your own, no trip to Alaska necessary! These are the same bags that we will be using in the project. With the bag you will also get a personal thank you note on our logo sticker, custom card, and the salmon recipe! 

$ 50 - SMOKED RED GOLD! The best salmon on earth! Not one but TWO jars smoked Wild Copper River Sockeye Salmon shipped to your door. Ready to eat, anytime anywhere. The only problem? You'll be hooked and want more! We will also send you a logo sticker, custom card, and our salmon recipe.

$ 100 - BAG 'O GOODIES! The canvas bag, Cordova's own Copper River Fleece socks (for men and women - really comfy warm for padding around the home on chilly days), a jar of Dune-caught smoked sockeye salmon, a set of 8 beautiful Alaska EPC gift cards, a Copper River stone, and a personal note from Dune and all of us EPC'ers.
$ 175 - FROZEN RED GOLD! Two Wild Copper River Sockeye Salmon fresh frozen fillets shipped right to your door.  The best wild, sustainable, organic, nutritious fish on the planet. Each fish is 'Dune- caught' or 'Tim Metz -caught' and processed in the best way to ensure outstanding quality. Dune's family has been fishing the Copper River for thousands of years. Here we honor and respect the food we eat. Know that you are getting simply the best! If you've only had store-bought salmon you're in for a huge surprise! You'll be hooked and want more! We will also send you a logo sticker, custom card, and our salmon recipe.

$ 500 - A variety pack of some of the seafoods we are blessed with here in Cordova! All fish and seafood is 100% wild, sustainable, organic and 'Dune - caught' - you know the fisherman and we know the fish! This perk is slightly customizable too. Options include salmon (of course!), halibut, cod, shrimp and more!  Work with us to get your hard to come by favorites at a much higher quality than you can buy from a store while supporting a great cause! We will also send you a logo sticker, custom card, and our salmon recipe.
$ 1,000 - Come experience Cordova first hand! For 2 lucky people this is the trip of a life time! Cordova is well off the beaten Alaskan tourist path. We would put you up in our beautiful lakeside home for 4 days while you hike, paddle, fish, eat fish and explore the Copper River Delta. Perk includes the stay, the food and a car. Airfare to Cordova not included. Date of stay is flexible. We will work with you to find the perfect time! (The following photo is the view from the wall of windows at the lodge!)

How Funds Will Be Used

Funds raised as a part of this campaign will cover:
  • Purchasing the reusable bags
  • Shipping bags to Cordova
  • Cost of stickers (other perks have been donated)
  • Perks shipping and distribution
  • Labor costs (volunteer hours are being contributed also)
  • Campaign costs (Indiegogo fees and credit card fees)

The Impact You Can Help Us Create

Over 1.2 million plastic bags are purchased and distributed each year by the two largest retail stores in Cordova. With a population of only 2,500 this means people here use and throw away over 340 plastic bags per person per year.  

By giving to this project, you will help: 

  • Keep plastic bags OUT of the Cordova landfill, the land and the sea
  • Increase support for public policies encouraging the use of reusable bags
  • Increase public awareness in other regional cities and villages in Alaska about bringing a reusable bag to the store

Risks & Challenges

The great news about this campaign is there are vitally no risks to you as a supporter of the campaign -- all perks have been acquired (or are already on order), and our estimated delivery dates are conservative so there is little risk to you there also.

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute? That's ok! There are other ways to get involved:

  • Make the conscious choice to NOT use a plastic bag when you shop - no matter where you live!
  • Get behind or start a movement in your community to ban the plastic bag-it's catching on in communities across the nation!
  • Make some noise! Indiegogo makes sharing this information easy.Tell people what we are doing to help our environment - share on all your social networks!
  • Follow EPC on facebook & sign up for our newsletter 

We believe that for every cloth bag we distribute we save countless plastic bags from needing to be produced. This is a small but important step in lessening the demands on earth’s non renewable resources.  

Thank you! 

The Eyak Preservation Council has been successfully saving habitat in our region of Alaska for over 25 years.

story:
Update: Machines are in-demand for recent Chennai Flood to provide clean drinking water to stranded population.
Recognising the threat of polluted water and plastic waste to health and the environment in India, Amrutdhara was formed to tackle these issues. A technological solution that could be implemented in the market was designed in the form of a water vending machine where users could refill their bottles. When we cut out the bottle, we found we could cut costs, and offer what consumers had really wanted all along, clean water, at half the price per liter of bottled water making safe drinking water more affordable for all. We envision a network of refill stations starting in our town of Pondicherry and expanding across India, making it easy to give up buying bottled water forever.

THE PROBLEM

There are a few issues that we are trying to solve by creating this solution. Primary among these is of course the affordable access to clean drinking water in urban India. Because this is such a huge issue plastic based packaged drinking water has filled this niche! This has led to huge growths (and growing volumes) in the amount of plastic waste being contributed to landfills and in our water systems. Here's a short video by Captain Charles Moore, one of the leading critics of plastic dumping in our oceans. 

Effects on humans and animals of the Great Pacific Garbage Patch(from wikipedia)

Some of these long-lasting plastics end up in the stomachs of marine birds and animals, and their young, including sea turtles and the black-footed albatross. Midway Atoll receives substantial amounts of marine debris from the patch. Of the 1.5 million Laysan albatrosses that inhabit Midway, nearly all are found to have plastic in their digestive system. Approximately one-third of their chicks die, and many of those deaths are due to being fed plastic from their parents. Twenty tons of plastic debris washes up on Midway every year with five tons of that debris being fed to albatross chicks.

Besides the particles' danger to wildlife, on the microscopic level the floating debris can absorb organic pollutants from seawater, including PCBs, DDT, and PAHs. Aside from toxic effects, when ingested, some of these are mistaken by the endocrine system as estradiol, causing hormone disruption in the affected animal. These toxin-containing plastic pieces are also eaten by jellyfish, which are then eaten by larger fish.

Many of these fish are then consumed by humans, resulting in their ingestion of toxic chemicals.

While recycling is certainly an option, we feel that as a species we need to move towards the principle of 'reduction' we need to curb our consumption habits to change what and how we consume to create real change at scale. But the need for drinking water when traveling is real and unmet, and hence our attempt at creating a real solution. 

HOW FAR WE’VE COME

Taking the initial idea, we hit the streets to understand consumer perceptions around drinking loose water through a series of lean experiments in Chennai and Pondicherry. Based on these experiences and consumer insight we set about creating the first round of prototypes. 

Founders Min and Akshay talking to citizens about their attitudes towards water.

We then designed and built a prototype for a vending machine with some friends that would enable shopkeepers in public spaces to sell drinking water to consumers with refillable bottles. We've been testing these initial prototypes with very favourable outcomes and results over the course of the last year. 


With the funding we raised in the previous indiegogo round, we went from garage tinkering to hiring a fluids engineering firm in Chennai to build the next, more reliable version of the machine

We’re a growing, close-knit team based mainly out of Auroville, India and have been straining to promote this solution with minimal funding and without wages since early 2013. We are looking to grow the executive team and bring on people in full time paid executive positions. We are also starting to hire a small team for design, research and operations.

This is the most crucial moment yet in the life of our start-up. The mountains we climb in the next few months will take us over the tipping point of our organisation into the full swing of the solution. Implementing a pilot over the next few months will prove to interested organisations that with long term funding, we can change the face of urban and semi-urban water usage in India We have established Feb 2016 as the horizon to raise about $160,000 in funding through grants and investment for the longer term, given that we’ve stepped up efforts now. You can help us get there and be one of the original supporters of a company that will go international.


OUR JOURNEY

In October 2012 we dreamed of a cleaner world, free of plastic waste. We started as activists campaigning to ‘Ban the Bottle’, lobbying the Pondicherry government to ban the sale of packaged drinking water. Our friends in local social and ecological organisations urged us to create viable alternatives before pursuing action through policy.

A few months later we sat down to design a simple solution that filtered water on site, tested water quality in real-time and allowed a shopkeeper to sell water to consumers bringing their own bottles.We started with a stand-alone water kiosk.

In August 2013, our co-founder and CEO Min, was selected to be part of Villgro’s Entrepreneur-in-residence programme. Their guidance finely tuned our operations to be more dynamic and we applied the structural principles of a lean startup: conducting continuous experiments in the field to gain insight into consumer and the market to perfect the product long before its launch.


Our early experiments were a window into consumers thoughts on drinking unpackaged water and carrying their own bottles. As we tested our stand-alone kiosk, looking at the role of marketing campaigns, and price in uptake, we realised convenience was of the upmost importance to users. If we wanted people to buy unpackaged water, they would need to have easy access wherever they were. 

With the kiosk, capital costs were too high and and logistics too complicated. We needed a cheaper, simpler and more mobile idea that could fit in any common shop so users could refill anywhere.

We pivoted and focused on modular vending machines that would allow us to quickly build a dense network in a city, fully optimising convenience for consumers. Fuelled by the funding provided to us by Villgro and grant money we won through an IIHS competition, we launched full throttle into developing the vending machine.

THE PROTOTYPE & THE PILOT

Working closely with partners over the last 15 months, we have developed a working prototype that transforms a standard bubble top dispenser into a water ATM. The consumer puts in coins, and the machine  dispenses filtered water. A small display on the front shows the results of testing the  water real-time to ensure that it has been through a functioning RO system.

We’re now working with an experienced fluid engineering firm based in Chennai, to build the next version of the product based on lessons learned from this prototype, in preparation for a 3 month pilot in Pondicherry to test the market and evaluate performance of the product.

The 3-month pilot consists of:

  • Setting up 10 machines in various shops in Pondicherry
  • Bringing on a partner for sales, distribution and operations
  • Conducting in-depth research around user behaviour and preferences to inform product design, sales and marketing
  • Applying logistical research to facilitate the whole administrative system including maintenance and operations

NEXT PHASE

This is where you come in and make all the difference in the fight against clean water scarcity and plastic waste. In the next four months as the pilot allows us to prove the viability of the product to long term investors and donors.

This is what your contribution will allow us to do:

  • Conduct the pilot rigorously and possibly expand the size
  • Set up a small office as our headquarters in Auroville
  • Bringing on partners for product design and developing the next version of electronics
Please Note: We are working with a registered non-profit 'Natural Innovation .org' for this campaign and other fundraising efforts. The remarks on your credit card/bank account might reflect that.

What else you can do:

  • Give us a like on Facebook or follow us on Twitter to hear more and get our message out there!
  • Check out our sparkling new website!
  • If you'd like to invest in the business then do write to us at min@amrutdhara.in

  • Pledge to carry a refillable bottle instead of buying new bottles of plastic water. Together we can move mountains!

story:
We are Hamilton Energy Recovery Action Group 

We are raising money for our campaign opposing the proposed incinerator that is planned for a site that borders Hamilton, Bothwell and Blantyre.

The proposed incinerator will emit large toxic particles that are predicted to fall within a 600 metre radius and small toxic particles that may travel up to 18 Kilometers from the site. Within the 600 metre radius are hundreds of houses, a primary school and a “Showpeople/Traveller” residential site. There is a guideline minimum of 250 metres to any home from these types of Incinerators, the Showpeople site would be 83 metres door to door, in fact fenceline to fenceline the gap is only 12 metres. 

As well as the toxins we have other concerns: 

  • Potential contamination to adjacent Woodland and it's wildlife
  • Site proximity to a “Green Corridor” that runs from the Clyde Valley past the site and further towards Glasgow
  • Smell 
  • Noise
  • Potential for uncontrolled fires 
  • Proximity to a Historic battlefield site (Battle of Bothwell Bridge).

We can stop this happening, protect our environment and safeguard the health of our community. In doing so we will also send a clear message to those planning other such developments happening across the country.  


What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to raise three thousand pounds to fund our campaign against the granting of a SEPA operator's licence to Clean Power Ltd. Our campaign is growing in size every week and we require this funding to continue. Funds raised will be spent on marketing and awareness products, travel, media submissions and general administration.

We are offering perks for contributions received, every single contribution regardless of size will receive a thank you. 

We will also be:

  • Giving thank you "shout outs" on social media
  • Emailing certificates as acknowledgement of contributions 
  • Sending out our bespoke campaign badge designed by the children of our community
  • Providing a "blog spot" on our site, so people can have a chance to describe what they are feeling and thinking as the campaign moves forward.  


Why this is relevant to you

This campaign is relevant to everyone. The incinerator poses a health threat to anyone you may know in the area around where the site is planned. In the wider context this campaign demonstrates that communities can come together for a common purpose and fight against faceless big business who have no concern for the environment we live in. 

Our Team

We have support from many different people. We have campaigners who successfully stopped another Incinerator that was planned in the area. We have MSPs and Councillors who have let their objection be known and regularly attend our meetings. Hamilton Accies Football Club Community Outreach Program is providing support. We have Professors, Professionals of various disciplines and a whole load of very passionate people determined to stop this Incinerator from happening.
We are organised, we have different subgroups pursuing different aspects of our campaign. Were having regular meetings, progress reports and issue reports. The Fundraising subgroup have put this Crowd Funding page together with the aim of supporting everyone else in a successful campaign.

Risks & Challenges

The planning consent was granted for the incinerator to Clean Power Ltd on the 14th August this year. The company have three years to get their operators licence, build the facility and put everything in place. 

In fighting the operators license we have potentially a long campaign ahead that will take a lot of energy and resolve. We will continue growing our number of supporters online and at grass roots level. Being appropriately funded, organised and focused we will see this through.


Other Ways You Can Help

We understand some people simply can't contribute, but there are other ways you can help:

  • Share this Funding page with everyone you know, by any means you can (Facebook/Twitter/Email/Text/Word of mouth).
  • Come and visit our Facebook page and learn more detail of our campaign www.facebook.com/HERAG2013
  • Sign petitions.
  • Send emails & Letters to the appropriate authorities.

Noise
Potential for uncontrolled fires 

Proximity to a Historic battlefield site (Battle of Bothwell Bridge).


We can stop this happening, protect our environment and safeguard the health of our community. In doing so we will also send a clear message to those planning other such developments happening across the country.  
   What We Need & What You Get We are looking to raise three thousand pounds to fund our campaign against the granting of a SEPA operator's licence to Clean Power Ltd. Our campaign is growing in size every week and we require this funding to continue. Funds raised will be spent on marketing and awareness products, travel, media submissions and general administration.
We are offering perks for contributions received, every single contribution regardless of size will receive a thank you. 
We will also be:


Giving thank you "shout outs" on social media
Emailing certificates as acknowledgement of contributions 
Sending out our bespoke campaign badge designed by the children of our community

Providing a "blog spot" on our site, so people can have a chance to describe what they are feeling and thinking as the campaign moves forward.  


   Why this is relevant to you


This campaign is relevant to everyone. The incinerator poses a health threat to anyone you may know in the area around where the site is planned. In the wider context this campaign demonstrates that communities can come together for a common purpose and fight against faceless big business who have no concern for the environment we live in. 

Our Team
We have support from many different people. We have campaigners who successfully stopped another Incinerator that was planned in the area. We have MSPs and Councillors who have let their objection be known and regularly attend our meetings. Hamilton Accies Football Club Community Outreach Program is providing support. We have Professors, Professionals of various disciplines and a whole load of very passionate people determined to stop this Incinerator from happening.

We are organised, we have different subgroups pursuing different aspects of our campaign. Were having regular meetings, progress reports and issue reports. The Fundraising subgroup have put this Crowd Funding page together with the aim of supporting everyone else in a successful campaign.
   Risks & Challenges The planning consent was granted for the incinerator to Clean Power Ltd on the 14th August this year. The company have three years to get their operators licence, build the facility and put everything in place. 
In fighting the operators license we have potentially a long campaign ahead that will take a lot of energy and resolve. We will continue growing our number of supporters online and at grass roots level. Being appropriately funded, organised and focused we will see this through.
   Other Ways You Can Help We understand some people simply can't contribute, but there are other ways you can help:

Share this Funding page with everyone you know, by any means you can (Facebook/Twitter/Email/Text/Word of mouth).
Come and visit our Facebook page and learn more detail of our campaign www.facebook.com/HERAG2013

Sign petitions.

Send emails & Letters to the appropriate authorities.

story:
WHO WE ARE

DogSpot is a non-profit organization or, how we are used to call ourselves – the rescuers of the flat-nosed dogs.

Our mission – come to the aid of homeless or abandoned French bulldogs, Pugs, English bulldogs, Pekingeses and Boxers (the most commonly – to the mixes of these breeds) and other unfortunate dogs. Our aim is to help and give a chance to all those, who became unwanted or ended up in the streets or state shelters because of their illness, inability, experienced traumas or other reasons.

If it would be more convenient - you are welcome to use PAYPAL. 

OUR “CLIENTS”
DogSpot fostered flat-nosed dogs are unwanted, abandoned, stray, sick or injured, or that can no longer be cared for by their owners.

Sadly, but the largest part of our fostered dogs (about 70 percent) are former “residents” and “workers” of the puppy mills.

A puppy mill is a commercial dog-breeding facility that focuses on increasing profit with little overhead cost. The health and welfare of the animals is not a priority for them. Female dogs are bred at every opportunity with no recovery time between litters. When, after a few years, they are physically depleted to the point they no longer can reproduce, breeding females are often killed.

In puppy mills, dogs can spend most of their lives in cramped cages, with no room to play or exercise. Often times, the water and food provided for the puppies is contaminated, crawling with bugs. Puppies in mills are found with bleeding or swollen paws, feet falling through the wire cages, severe tooth decay, ear infections, dehydration, and lesions on their eyes, which often lead to blindness.

Most puppy mills have no veterinary care, climate control, or protection for the animals from weather (hot, cold, rain, or snow). With limited or no regulations or enforcement, puppy mills have no cleanup control. This means that dogs can be living in urine and feces for indefinite periods of time.

Every puppy sold by the puppy mill has a mother who will spend her entire life in a tiny cage, never being petted, never being walked, never being treated like a living being.
Our task is not only to ensure treatment and rehabilitation of their injured and ill bodies. Our purpose is to restore their belief in humans. Our mission – to give them a chance to a new life. Life which they are more than worth of.

THE MAIN PRINCIPLES OF OUR WORK
DogSpot is a rescue organization that acts as a bridge between a dog’s past life and its future forever home. Our rescue organization has no building and no business hours. It is a group of volunteers who we call DogSpot Team or just, simply, DogSpot Family. Currently our network of volunteers and foster homes spreads all over Lithuania, but the main “spots” are located in Vilnius, Kaunas, Siauliai and Klaipeda Cities.

We are a no-kill rescue and never turn away any flat-nosed dog due to illness, medical needs or age. 


VETERINARY CARE
We provide necessary veterinary treatment including vet exams, blood tests, deworming, protection from fleas and ticks, vaccination, spay/neuter procedures, microchipping and dental care as basic medical care for our dogs. This is just a small part of the whole medical care services our dogs get. So it is no surprise that costs for veterinary services make the largest part of our expenses. Complicated surgeries, computed tomography, high quality food for treatment of various issues... It is quite clear, why we still donʾt have a place, a spot, where to stay with our dogs.

An important point of our practice – spay neuter procedures, as this is the only way to control the population of the stray dogs and to prevent the exploitation of mix breed flat-nosed dogs.
We also address emotional and behavioral issues.

About 80 percent of our flat-nosed dogs are seriously neglected and abused, so their preparation for the new home can take from 3 to 6 months.

ADOPTION
DogSpot it is not an animal shelter where a potential adopter can drop by, choose a dog and take it home. Potential adopters are carefully checked and must pass the particular process of selecting the best option for our fostered dogs as a future home. We want to be absolutely sure that our fostered dogs, who have suffered so much already in the past, donʾt wind up back in rescue and have to undergo the process again because of an inappropriate adoption.

DONATIONS
As a non-profit organization, we rely on donations from the community. Contrary to the thinking of common people, we don’t obtain any state funding. The main donations reach us from the community (the citizens), some enterprises / companies or through fund-raising campaigns (like Christmas Fair, our organized events, initiatives of other kind people and similar).

There are many ways in which you can donate to DogSpot, be it with your time, your skills, adopting, fostering or by making a financial donation.

Your donations will help us provide the necessary medical care that many our foster dogs so dearly need. Did you know that the average medical bill for our fostered flat-nosed dog before they are ready for re-homing is in average about five hundred euros?

Despite the costs of our rescue activity, there is no adoption fee for our adopted dog. We believe that the best “donation” or “gift”, doesn’t matter, how we call it – is a new and real HOME for all our fostered dog, regardless of their age, appearance or remaining health issues.

HOW DO WE DO IT
All our work is based on the network of temporary fostering homes. This means that we arenʾt and we donʾt see ourselves as a common or traditional shelter. In our opinion the appropriate fostering and care of our fostered flat-nosed dogs is possible only under home-like conditions. Therefore it is our main way of care and rehabilitation.

For already 4 years we have been spending at least 4-5 months at the rented homestead near Vilnius, which we are calling DogSpot Village. But the standards of keeping our fostered dogs here also remain the same – dogs live in their rooms, they have every possibility to spend their time free and without any space restrictions (for example, cages). We have noticed that in this environment our dogs feel just great! More space for playing in the yard, fresh air, nature, more activities, movement, more opportunities to implement rehabilitation steps.

Since we started we have rescued 345 dogs, most of them came from horrible conditions (usually – puppy mills), left outside, covered in dirt, fleas, malnourished, exhausted, abused, scared of their own shadow.

SO WHAT IS THE BIG DREAM?
We have been working with abandoned and neglected flat-nosed dogs for five years already. We have no holidays, no weekends, no time to say “NO” or “THE END”. As our helping hands are a big BEGINNING of something new, something amazing for the dogs, who had never felt the breeze of fresh air, who had never experienced the touch of green grass and who never imagined their life could be different than cage, neglect, abuse and one pregnancy after another...

Our dream is to establish our own DogSpot Village. A rehabilitation place, center, for our fostered flat-nosed dogs and other dogs who experienced traumas. It is our dream for such a long time... Maybe it is time to make this dream come true?

Homestead or DogSpot Village would allow to accept more unnecessary dogs, to make our work more efficient. It would be a place of our own. No rents, not temporary premises. Our fostered dogs would be completely safe and we would be able to work with less stress. It would be a place for all those, who arenʾt able to find their true homes because of their age, illnesses or health pathologies.

Help us make this DREAM come true and become the superheroes of the flat-noses!

VISION OF THE REHABILITATION SPOT
The main point of the rehabilitation center is to create space, conditions and means for the more efficient rehabilitation of our fostered dogs.

We are planning to establish a rehabilitation zone with treadmill, stability balls, stimulating mats and other dog gym equipment. On the same floor a place for quarantine is foreseen, a cabinet for procedures (for example, for massage, light therapy, acupuncture and electrostimulation with NeuroTrac TENS machines) and a dog bath tub.

All our fostered flat-noses would live in the rooms specially designed and arranged for them. Also we would have a general space (living room) with kitchen.

Outdoor area would be used for a swimming pool, as water procedures (hydrotherapy) are in particular useful for the dogs after spinal and knee-cap surgeries. Also it would be a great activity for our beloved senior fostered dogs – swimming is highly beneficial for older dogs both for strengthening of muscles and treatment of arthritis. As we are cooperating with dog training schools, our own space would allow arranging joined lessons for our fostered dogs in order to help cope them with fears and to solve their behavior issues more efficiently.

We have a lot of experience in the field of canine rehabilitation. We know, how obtain high level results even with the use of quite “domestic” measures. Can you imagine what we would be able to do if we had the specialized and equipped place – DogSpot rehabilitation center?

*************************

KAS MES ESAME?
DogSpotas yra ne pelno siekianti organizacija arba, kaip save vadiname, suplotasnukių gelbėtojai.
Mūsų misija – ištiesti pagalbos ranką bei surasti naujus namus benamiams suplotasnukiams (prancūzų buldogams, anglų buldogams, mopsams, pekinams, bokseriams bei šių veislių mišrūnams) ir kitiems likimo nuskriaustiems šunims, kurie dėl ligų, negalios, patirtų traumų ar kitų priežasčių tapo nereikalingi, atsidūrė gatvėje arba sanitarinėse tarnybose.

MŪSŲ „KLIENTAI“
Dalies DogSpoto globojamų suplotasnukių atsisako šeimininkai. Vieni į globą atkeliauja iš vietinių sanitarinių tarnybų, kitus žmonės tiesiog palieka veterinarinėse klinikose.

Deja, didžiausia globotinių dalis (apie 70 proc.) – buvę daugyklų „gyventojai“ ir „darbuotojai“. Išnaudoti, išsunkti, atrodytų, iki paskutinio lašo.

Šunų daugykla yra vieta, kurioje visas dėmesys skiriamas kuo didesniam pelnui. Kuo mažesnės išlaidos dauginamiems gyvūnams – tuo didesnis pelnas lieka daugintojui. Natūralu, gyvūnų sveikata ir gerovė šioje grandyje lieka paskutinėje vietoje. Kalės yra kergiamos per kiekvieną rują, pradedant nuo labai ankstyvo amžiaus (pirmosios rujos). Rujoms padažninti kalėms leidžiami hormonai. Joms ne tik nepakanka laiko atgauti jėgas tarp vadų, bet dėl prastų laikymo sąlygų, skurdžios mitybos bei patiriamo streso, jos gana per trumpą laiką tampa nebetinkamos veisimui, todėl yra užmigdomos arba nužudomos kitais būdais.

Daugyklose šunys didžiąją laiko dalį dažniausiai praleidžia ankštuose narvuose, tvartuose arba voljeruose Narvuose laikomi šunys yra priversti vaikščioti vielinėmis grotomis, kurios žaloja ir
deformuoja letenas. Nesulaukę reikiamos veterinarinės pagalbos bei priežiūros daugyklų „gyventojai“ kenčia nuo ausų infekcijų, įvairių odos ligų, dehidratacijos, mažakraujystės, akių opų bei ragenų uždegimų, kurie negydomi priveda iki aklumo.

Pirkėjai, norintys kuo pigiau įsigyti į vieną ar kitą veislę panašų šunelį, sukuria paklausą, kurią daugintojai siekia patenkinti. Nedaugelis susimąsto, kad „pigesnis“ šuniukas turi savo kainą. Ir ji – labai didelė. Tai daugyklose kankinamos kalės ir reproduktoriai, kurie visą gyvenimą praleidžia ankštame narve, prieblandoje, baisioje smarvėje, niekada nevedžiojami, neglostomi, dažnai gulintys savo šlapime ir išmatose.

Mūsų užduotis ne tik gydyti ir reabilituoti jų suluošintus kūnus. Mūsų tikslas – išmokyti juos vėl patikėti žmogumi. Mūsų misija – suteikti jiems naują gyvenimą, kurio jie yra daugiau, nei verti.

PAGRINDINIAI VEIKLOS PRINCIPAI
DogSpoto organizacija yra tik laikina stotelė tarp šuns buvusio gyvenimo ir naujojo gyvenimo tikruose namuose. Mūsų organizacija neturi būstinės, mes neturime nustatytų darbo valandų. Mes turime šaunių savanorių, kuriuos vadiname DogSpoto komanda arba, tiesiog DogSpoto šeima. Šiuo metu mūsų savanorių ir globėjų namų tinklas apima įvairius Lietuvos kampelius, tačiau pagrindinės atstovybės yra Vilniuje, Kaune, Šiauliuose ir Klaipėdoje.

Mūsų organizacijoje gyvūnams nėra taikoma eutanazija ir mes niekada nenusigręžiame bei nesakome „NE“ suplotasnukiui, kuriam reikia pagalbos, dėl jo ligų, medicininių poreikių ar amžiaus.

VETERINARINĖ PRIEŽIŪRA
Savo globotiniams užtikriname reikiamą veterinarinę priežiūrą bei gydymą. Globotiniams atliekamos apžiūros, kraujo tyrimai, jie nukirminami, skiepijami, ženklinami. Tai tik dalis visiems atliekamų procedūrų – būtent veterinarinės išlaidos sudaro didžiausią mūsų sąnaudų dalį.
Labai dažnai globotiniams prireikia sudėtingų operacijų, kompiuterinės tomografijos tyrimų, kokybiškų gydomųjų pašarų ir kitų procedūrų.Būtent veterinarinės išlaidos sudaro didžiausią mūsų sąnaudų dalį.

Labai svarbus aspektas mūsų veikloje – sterilizacija ir kastracija. Tai vienintelis būdas kontroliuoti beglobių gyvūnų populiaciją bei užkirsti kelią į vieną ar kitą veislę panašių gyvūnų išnaudojimui.

Didelį dėmesį skiriame globotinių emociniams poreikiams bei elgsenos problemoms.
Apie 80 procentų mūsų globojamų suplotasnukių yra smarkiai neprižiūrėti ir apleisti, taigi jų paruošimas į naujus namus gali užtrukti nuo 3 iki 6 mėnesių.

NAMŲ SUTEIKIMAS
DogSpotas nėra įprasta gyvūnų prieglauda, į kurią atvykę norėtojai gali išsirinkti šunį ir parsivežti jį namo. Potencialūs „norėtojai“ yra kruopščiai atrenkami ir privalo atitikti tam tikrus kriterijus. Tokiu būdu siekiame savo globotiniams surasti pačius geriausius namus. Mūsų tikslas – tinkamiems norėtojams surasti jiems tobulai tinkamą globotinį. Mes norime būti visiškai tikri, kad dėl nekokybiško dovanojimo daug praeityje kentėję suplotasnukiai vėl nebūtų išduoti, neprižiūrimi ar kitaip skriaudžiami.

AUKOJIMAS
Kadangi DogSpotas yra ne pelno siekianti viešoji įstaiga, už didžiąją veiklai reikalingą lėšų dalį esame dėkingi paprastiems žmonėms. Priešingai nei daugelis galvoja, valstybė nefinansuoja gyvūnų prieglaudų ir gyvūnų gerovės organizacijų veiklų. Pagrindiniai aukotojai yra gyventojai bei įmonės, taip pat reikiamų lėšų pavyksta surinkti įvairių renginių (pavyzdžiui, Kalėdinės mugės beglobiams paremti) bei pavienių žmonių iniciatyvumo dėka. Didelė finansinė paspirtis – 2 proc. nuo GPM parama, kurią gauname kartą per metus.

Prisidėti prie DogSpoto veiklos galima įvairiausiais būdais: galite skirti savo laiką, įgūdžius, užsiimti laikina globa arba skirti norimo dydžio auką (mažų aukų – nėra).

Jūsų aukos padės mums užtikrinti tinkamą globotinių priežiūrą bei gydymą, kurio kaina neretai siekia įspūdingas sumas. Ar žinojote, kad vidutinės išlaidos, kurių prireikia norint paruošti vieną mūsų globotinį išvykimui į naujus namus, siekia apie penkis šimtus eurų?

Nepaisant mūsų gelbėjimo veiklos išlaidų, Jums nereikės mokėti jokių mokesčių norint į savo šeimą priimti DogSpoto globotinį.

Mes esame tikri, kad geriausia „auka“ ar „dovana“ yra NAUJI ir TIKRI namai mūsų išglobotam suplotasnukiui. Nepriklausomai nuo jo amžiaus, išvaizdos ir sveikatos ypatumų.

KAIP MES DIRBAME?
Visus ketverius metus dirbome namų globų tinklo principu. Tai reiškia, kad mes nesame ir nelaikome savęs įprasta šunų prieglauda. Mes manome, kad tinkama mūsų globotinių priežiūra yra įmanoma tik namų sąlygomis, todėl stengiamės tai suteikti ir užtikrinti visiems savo globotiniams. Tai leidžia mums ne tik kokybiškai išslaugyti, reabilituoti globotinį, bet ir pasirūpinti jo psichologinėmis reikmėmis, socializacija, dresūra.

Jau trejus metus, kiekvieną vasarą mažiausiai 4-5 mėnesius praleidžiame nuomojamoje sodyboje, kurią vadiname DogSpoto Kaimu. Tačiau globotinių laikymo standartai čia nesikeičia – šunys gyvena kambariukuose, taigi jų laikymo sąlygos labiau primena laikinus namus. Pastebėjome, kad sodyboje šunys jaučiasi ypač gerai – daugiau laisvės judėti, gamta, grynas oras, daugiau veiklos, aktyvumo, daugiau galimybių užsiimti mankštomis bei reabilitacija baseine.

TAI KOKIA TA MŪSŲ DIDŽIOJI SVAJONĖ?
Jau ketvirti metai be atokvėpio dirbame ir gelbėjame likimo nuskriaustus suplotasnukius. Vieni kitus paremdami, padrąsindami ir palaikydami. Apie nuosavą DogSpoto Kaimą, apie reabilitacijos centrą globojamiems suplotasnukiams bei kitiems traumas patyrusiems šunims svajojame jau seniai. Galbūt atėjo laikas šiai svajonei išsipildyti?

Sodyba arba DogSpoto kaimas leistų mums be streso priimti daugiau globotinių, kokybiškiau juos globoti ir reabilituoti. Tai būtų vieta, kurioje nebūtume svečiai, nebūtume nuomininkai. Tai būtų saugi užuovėja ir prieglobstis mūsų globotiniams. Tai būtų vieta, kurioje jiems skirtą laiką nugyventų visi globotiniai, kurie taip ir nerado namų dėl savo amžiaus, ligų ar patologijų.
Padėkite svajonei išsipildyti ir tapkite suplotasnukių superherojais!

REABILITACIJOS CENTRO VIZIJA
Reabilitacijos centro esmė – sukurti erdvę, sąlygas bei priemones efektyvesniam globotinių reabilitavimui.

Planuojama reabilitacijos zona su bėgimo takeliu, balansiniais kamuoliais, stimuliuojančiais kilimėliais ir kitomis šunų mankštai reikalingomis priemonėmis. Tame pačiame aukšte planuojama karantino vieta, procedūrų kabinetas (pavyzdžiui, masažo, šviesox terapijos, akupunktūros, elektrostimuliacijos procedūroms), gyvūnų maudymui skirta vonia.

Visi šunys gyventų specialiai jiems skirtuose, pagal poreikius pritaikytuose kambariuose. Taip pat būtų suformuota bendra zona (svetainė) su virtuve.

Lauke būtų įrengtas baseinas. Vandens procedūros (hidroterapija) ypatingai naudingos šunims po stuburo išvaržų, girnelių operacijų, o taip pat pasitarnautų senjorų raumenų stiprinimui. Kadangi bendradarbiaujame su dresūros mokyklomis, turėdami savo kiemą galėtume rengti jungtines dresūros pamokas savo globotiniams, padėti įveikti jiems savo baimes ir efektyviau spręsti elgsenos problemas.

Reabilitacijos srityje turime tikrai daug patirties. Žinome, kaip pasiekti ypač gerą rezultatą naudojant, atrodytų, gana „buitines“ priemones. Tik pagalvokite, ką galėtume nuveikti, jeigu turėtume tam skirtą ir pritaikytą vietą – DogSpoto reabilitacijos centrą.
